description:
I've seen this inviting brunch cafe on my evening walks on Valencia, but it closes at 6PM during the week and an hour later on weekends. It wasn't until I passed by in the daytime that I saw it in operation. Only one woman runs the entire cafe, and I was honestly feeling sorry for her because she was looking understandably a bit exhausted by 2:30PM when I showed up. Now I had no idea that the signature dish was the $9.75 Blue Waffle made of organic blue cornmeal topped with fresh fruit and ladled with a fig reduction. The cafe's name must come from this colorful creation.

However, for me, I didn't want to be so calorifically suicidal and went for the $7.75 Greek Yogurt which normally comes with their housemade granola. At that hour unfortunately, she was out of the granola and consequently gave me a double helping of the yogurt along with a drizzle of honey and fresh strawberries, blueberries, and banana slices (photo: http://bit.ly/2xh1o8Y). Surprisingly I didn't miss the crunch of the granola, though it was more yogurt than I could digest in one sitting. The $2.75 Cafe au Lait was the perfect accompaniment (photo: http://bit.ly/2QyctKV). Still I do need to return for that blue waffle, don't I?

FOOD - 4 stars...fresh yogurt served like an ice cream sundae
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...cozy space with a parklet in front and a patio in the back
SERVICE - 4 stars...one woman does it all...so what's new?
TOTAL - 4 stars...visions of blue waffles dance in my head

RELATED - Looking for other dining options in the Mission? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2PJFItz
author: Ed U.

description:
Good breakfast and lunch menu, expensive, but everything (food and drinks) are made to order.
Food items are $11-13, drinks $3-5. Everything is great and some organic ingredients. Lots of vegan options.
Nice Cafe to eat in and outdoor seating. Take out offered too.
I had the brioche French toast and a chai. $19.26
She steamed the chai when I ordered, and the French toast took about 10 min because she mixed the batter, soaked the bread and cooked it to order.
CASH ONLY
author: Claire C.

description:
Although it's been several months since my visit, I recently made a Yelp account and want to share the garbage fire of an experience.

My friend and I stepped in and saw only one person working. Any sympathy we had quickly evaporated because the guy's service was abysmal. We sat in the back patio and when our "French toast" arrived, our request for another plate and utensils was met with a hostile "I've got other customers."

Baked French Toast: Absolutely hideous, and a lie. Because it wasn't made with an egg, biting it was like shoveling sand into my mouth. Although the menu says the baked French toast is made with brioche, we were given cinnamon raisin bread. When we pointed out the error, the worker insisted that it was brioche. How stupid does this rude person think we are?

Although the patio itself was nice, my friend and I abandoned the plate and hightailed it out of the darkness. I hope that guy is no longer employed because it's best to not pay someone to sabotage your business.
author: Chad S.

description:
A small but pretty awesome cafe that has a big window that lets you people watch as you sip on your tea/coffee. 

I got a hot tea that was of good quality, I just wish I had been given an actual cup instead of the plastic one I was given. I also ordered a chicken empanada that was delicious and truly hit the spot. It was a good snack for me while I did work and waited to eventually get dinner. I didn't get a chance to try their Greek yogurt with fruit dish but my friend ordered it and seemed to be pleased. Next time I'm in the mix I'll definitely order that. 

One of my favorite things about this location was that they had a grand window that allowed natural light in as well as allowing me to distract myself by people watching. There's also a nice patio in the back to relax in but it was a chilly day so I passed and stayed inside. 

The service was excellent, the lady taking my order was patient and nice when taking my order. Even though I stood there for a while trying to figure what to order (fear not, no one was behind me so I didn't ruin anyone's day). 

I would definitely recommend checking this location out. Of the many coffee shops I visited while in the area this was one of my favorites.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description:
Props to Blue Fig for serving me the best croque madame of my life. Sure, there's something definitively quaint about sitting down at a sidewalk café in Paris and leisurely eating a croque madame, but trendy restaurants in the Mission also have their own charm! Cash-only policies that will have your friend awkwardly asking, "Hey, uh, can I Venmo you for this...?" when you're ordering! Overworked employees in the ridiculously small kitchen! Aesthetically pleasing back patio seating to distract you from the long wait!

I'm still mindblown by the heavenly combination of béchamel sauce and Gruyère cheese, both of which created a rich array of flavors instead of overpowering each other. Don't think twice about ordering the croque madame.
author: Amy C.

description: Poor service - so much so that we left without ordering.  So I can't speak to the quality of the food.  The restroom was a mess, it's cash only (which it doesn't say anywhere - I only found out once I was about to pay), and the server was indifferent if we ordered or not.
author: Sarah Louise H.

description: Amazing place, some room for improvement is outlets for charging in the patio and being able to pay with card!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Cute coffee shop! I came here on a Wednesday afternoon to work and get some food. I got the most popular item - a ham & egg sandwich on foccacia bread with aioli (I got it without cheese since I don't eat cheese). They are cash only, and make everything to order, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you are in a rush.

I sat in the back patio since it was a nice day outside to work and wait for my food (I am a sucker for patios if it's sunny outside). I was pretty hungry, and had gotten an acai bowl across the street at my favorite acai bowl place (Sidewalk Juice), so I ended up eating half of that first while I was waiting lol. My food came in about 20 minutes, and there were about 5 other people outside on the patio with me. The sandwich was really good! Mainly because of the toasted bread and the aioli, which had a fresh herby flavor to it. Would come back to chill on a sunny day.
author: Betty M.

description:
In the past I've raved about the French toast. Came through this weekend and ordered it, was severely disappointed. 

In a nutshell:
It wasn't made with brioche- it was made out of cinnamon raisin bread (which is delicious on its own but not it's not brioche, and it's definitely not the brioche they used to use)

It wasn't French toast- there was no egg. It was essentially toasted bread sprinkled with cinnamon sugar and the other toppings advertised. 

The service was a train wreck. Came through on Sunday afternoon and it wasn't too crowded. One other party of 2 in the backyard, and a small group of 2-3 behind us. When the food was delivered to us, we asked for an additional plate as well as silverware since none were put out in the communal area where you'd normally grab them from. Was met with a flippant "I've got other customers" before the staff person walked away from us. Hire more people to work busy shifts & even in a short staffed situation, don't talk to your patrons like that!

I was with a friend visiting from out of town and it was straight up embarrassing to bring him here with the rudeness. Never coming here again, yikes!
author: Jeanine S.

description:
This is the cutest little coffee shop! I am in love with the cute hidden patio in the back. 

I came to the city early one day and ate breakfast down the street. After a nice foodie experience, i wanted to find a coffee place that was not too crowded. That is when I spotted the Blue Fig. They had big window in the front that allowed me to see the small quiet grouping of chairs and tables sprinkled in front of the cashier. It was a very inviting view so I entered and am so glad I did!

I walked up to the front and ordered my soy vanilla latte and a small muffin. I noticed when I was waiting for my coffee that the sun was beating down on the tables so I asked if a curtain or blinds were available. That is when I was told about the patio in back. 

This patio is so cute and very cool, temperature cool and aesthetically cool! I am sure the midday sun could wreak havoc but the patio is too cute to ignore. Make sure you stop in for a cup of coffee and enjoy the scene. On this hidden chill spot.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Possibly my favorite coffee shop atm. Cool french cafe thats very wifi friendly, has great coffee for cheap, a light tasty breakfast and lunch menu, and most importantly the most friendly service in town. I ordered several huge glasses of the house coffee and later on when I got hungry the croque madame. Solid coffee and one of the best croques around both in taste and presentation.
author: Sean G.

description:
This local GEM tends to appeal to residents rather than tourists for an important reason that makes it the place for you if you live in the vicinity. 
1) IT's SLOW at the cash register and slow to prep the food because usually there is only one person working the register and the kitchen.
2) SLOW means I can peacefully laptop work in this cafe because it is quiet, beautiful, and charming and I am appreciated for my patronage. 
3) SLOW means the food is sparkling with fresh ingredients which dance on the tongue, preparation is done with attention and care, and is wholesome and nourishing.  
4) SLOW means that the throngs of fresh faced SF newbies will get nervous and distracted by lack of a Square driven, rapid swipe terminal and move onto more familiar crowded millennial hipster terrain at Boba Guys and Ritual coffee.

Every item is delicious. So if you have some time on your hands and want to feel at home chatting with a friend or making progress in your work while big band jazz music plays in the background, I'll see you here.
author: Lovina H.

description:
Original review was going to post, but gave another chance: 
"Good egg sandwiches! Awful service. Incredibly slow.

Tried to circumvent the slow service by calling in an order which was promised to be ready in "10 minutes" and then waited an extra 25 once at the restaurant. Probably not returning. 

I recommend Fiore Cafe on 24th! Great Benedict's and good pastries"

New review:
Ordered egg sandwich and Irish oats. Waited 40 minutes before asking how much longer my order would be. They had forgotten my order entirely despite the order slip sitting hanging in the kitchen. They gave me food in the next 5 minutes, but the order was wrong. 

The food is always fine. But the service couldn't be more disappointing. Will sadly not be returning. Recommend Fiores, Wise Sons, Crepe House, Morning Dew.
author: Will R.

description: Quiet place I was the only one in the coffee shop, I was working on my computer  until I heard an old guy screaming CLOSED CLOSED CLOSED three time. So confused I packed my stuff and left. It was 4pm and there's no sign saying that they close at 4, even yelp says 6pm. I was never kicked out this way not to mention that I was there for less than 30min. Never going to this place again.
author: Medi M.

description:
I had the breakfast egg sandwich here. It was not bad (egg, ham, pickle/dill sauce, cheese on foccacia), but I probably wouldn't come back for it. 

This place is also a little bit small and the wifi doesn't work very well.
author: Jeanette S.

description: Best breakfast sandwich ever!!!! Love the space back patio. Great place to sip coffee and check emails if you're into that kind of thing
author: ngoc l.

description: I went to lunch early, at 11:30, walking down Valencia looking for a place I'd not yet been. I could see through the front window of the Blue Fig that a woman was being served what looked like a very nice croque madame. There were several tables free out front on the sidewalk, and the weather was lovely, so I decided to give it a try. I ordered before I saw that a few Yelp reviews mentioned slow service. The woman who took my order was the owner, and she was just the nicest person, from Mongolia. In truth, I was a little nervous because her English was not great, and I wondered how much practice a person gets in Mongolia to perfect a French croque madame. Any worries I had dissolved when my food arrived. It was absolutely delicious--bread perfectly toasted, smoky ham, melted cheese, whole-grain mustard, creamy bechamel, a soft fried egg, and some dribbles of basil oil that added just the right touch. It was filling but not heavy, and so good that I seriously thought of coming back later for another one. Like, for real. Maybe her service is slow at busy times, since it's just her there. So, go at an off hour and get yourself a truly delicious croque madame. Hey, you'd be supporting a business that is woman-owned, immigrant-owned, and also has yummy food. Not bad, right?
author: alex a.

description:
Little cafe with fantastically fresh food, cooked to order by the person who you just paid at the register. 

I had the blue waffle, made with blue cornmeal, topped with blueberries, strawberries, and real whipped cream. It was the amaze! Fantastic cornmeal crunch in fluffy waffle form. 

My wife had the croque provincal. Bavarian ham, whole grain mustard, tomatoes, gruyere cheese on brioche and topped with bechamel sauce. Also the amaze! 

High five!
author: Adam G.

description: I get that it's only one girl but I waited over 20 minutes for a bagel with cream cheese and a hot chocolate and never got it because I had to leave. 3 people who ordered after me all got their more complicated sandwiches while I waited
author: Sierra F.

description: Disappointing. Hire more people to work a shift. Teach them how to cook a egg. Get a credit card machine. Have wanted to like but every time food takes 20 minutes, the eggs are overcooked, and I feel like a idiot for paying you $10
author: Gabriele L.

description: Cash only which is huge bummer. We ordered their French toast which was too sweet and the croquet madame which was swimming in sauce. I wonder how much the person who said this was "the best croquet madame" they've had got paid.  I'd avoid and never come back.
author: Enoch L.

description: Good food, but could do without the employee doing loud skype video calls in an otherwise silent cafe, regardless of whether or not its for work.
author: Matthew W.

description: The only good thing about this cafe is it's signage outside. The Roma sandwhich was awful, no taste. The bench outside was wabbly. There is nothing special about this place, except the sign outside, which is the reason I came in.  False advertisement. A cookie cost me $3.95...awful, awful!
author: Nonyourbiz V.

description: Been wanting to try this place for a while and I gotta say, it's pretty underwhelming. Sandwich was ok. The bread was dry, but the sauce on top kinda made up for it. The fries were the best part of our food. What almost made me walk back out was the fact that this place is cash only. I agreed to use the atm-machine on sight, knowing I now had to pay an extra fee to take out cash. ATM did not work, which seems to happen a lot, since the lady behind the counter told me this happens quite often. I then had to walk across the street to use another atm. A whole lotta extra work for an at most average sandwich. The patio however is a plus.
author: Alex M.

description: DIRTY. Not a place for brunch. I pulled out 5 forks with food on them before finding one semi-clean one. SLOW service. Will not go back.
author: Erin C.

description:
Good people good food takes some time but its to be be specter as it's made to order.

Highly recommended breakfast spot.
author: Gil A.

description:
It's a perfect SF day at 75 degrees. I'm hungry and I've been walking for several blocks in search of food. Everywhere in the Mission is an hour plus wait. Stumbled upon this spot and they had some outdoor seating so went for it. I ordered the potato pancakes. Good flavor but needed to be cooked a bit more. It was definitely on the mushy side. There were times were I felt like I was eating straight batter. My sister ordered a yogurt and I'm not quite sure why it took over 20 mins to make. My potato pancakes came out before her yogurt. Odd. 

On a positive note, good Latte and friendly staff.

Cash only.
author: Grace V.

description:
The Valencia Street area of the Mission District has changed so much, with many new restaurants and coffee shops popping up all up and down the street. Blue Fig is relatively new. We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon. The place is pretty small, but they make use of a small patio out back, and the street patio out front. We ordered a couple sandwiches, the reuben, and turkey sandwich with mushroom tapenade. We also ordered some fries which turns out are homefries style like you would get with a breakfast meal. I found it interesting that there was only one person working here. We walked up to the counter and she took our order. Then she made them, served them, and i saw her doing the dishes was well. Kind of spreading yourself thin there.
Unfortunately an inexpensive lunch in the Mission is harder to find anymore. And the Blue Fig is no exception. Our 2 sandwiches, 1 small order of fries and 1 ice tea, was $30.
author: Greg S.

description: By far, the cozy courtyard in the back is the best part of this shop. Perfect place to catch up with an old friend over a warm cup of joe and some brunch. I expected a little bit more from the food, considering the wait time, but overall, not bad at all. I had the Roma breakfast which was top notch, and French toast which was pretty average. I'll definitely be coming back
author: Andrew N.

description: Coffee is pretty burnt tasting. Drank a 1/3 and decided to go elsewhere for a better cup at the same price.  Waffle clever idea with blue corn, but not a whole lot of flavor. Cash only.
author: Grant M.

description:
The coffee is no bueno. I suggest getting your espresso fix down the street at Ritual. 

The food is not terrible but it's overpriced. An egg sandwich with one piece of ham costs $8. No side salad, nothing. The blue cornmeal waffle is delicious but also pricey. Sometimes, they run out of fruit so you only get one scoop of blueberries with your waffle. Regardless, I still come back occasionally for this waffle. 

Also, this is not a quick grab and go type of place. It's soooo slow. It takes around 30 minutes to get your food and coffee. How is that even possible given the simplicity of the menu items? 

Tip -- Cash only but there's an ATM right by the cashier... if you don't mind the fee.
author: Xinxin W.

description:
I've been here twice now and it's a nice place to spend an afternoon. Their coffee is good and I've tried their cookies and home fries, which were cheap and filling.

I always need an outlet, otherwise I might enjoy their outdoor patio. The bathroom is nice and clean!

Wifi password is loveislove.
author: Ariana C.

description:
A typical coffee house with a splash of that new age mission attitude. The seating is just comfortable enough to enjoy your coffee but not comfortable enough to do work at. So have a personally made cappuccino and indulge in an organic cookie at a table, and leave your laptop at home.

Good for outdoor seating (there's a parklet in front) and solid cappuccinos.
author: Regina D.

description:
Really cute outdoor space in the back with wooden tables and backyard string lighting.  Yes, it takes a while for your order to be made, but they have free wifi so I was able to get some work done while the food came out.  We ordered the Baked French Toast--pretty scrumptious and served with some yummy blueberries, strawberries, and bananas with whipped cream and candied pecans.  Nice cinnamon-y flavor.  We also got the Roma breakfast sandwich which had a gooey egg, tomatoes, cheese, and delicious basil.  I also ordered a latte which was pretty good--not the best I've had but still pretty good.  Mine did not have as beautiful latte art that some of the other Yelpers received.

We enjoyed both of the dishes and would definitely return for the ambiance and food.  Cash only, too!
author: Jess Y.

description: Delicious breakfast and coffee. Cute relaxing patio!! Decent pricing! Try the waffle!
author: Cortny R.

description: It was packed and a better place to go for food than just grab a drink. Honestly, if you're going to grab a cup of coffee right next door is ritual coffee and they are better for a drink. Yet, here the food is what makes it, but be ready to wait a long time for your meal.
author: Tooka Z.

description:
I'll keep it brief - 

I ordered the Croque Monsieur. It was okay. The problem is the service time. We arrived and ordered when there weren't a lot of customers (11am Sunday), but it took 40 min - 1 hour for the food get to our table. It was 3 relatively straightforward sandwiches. I don't think I will return for fear of waiting that long again.
author: Vivian L.

description: The café is incredibly pleasant on the inside. Both the drinks and the breakfast options are fantastic. I would highly recommend this café on a Sunday morning with their delicious Irish Oats.
author: Jesse L.

description:
Small place, small menu... delicious coffee + eats. I actually love a place with a small menu, large menus can be overwhelming and make you feel like nothing can be "that" good if they have so many things. I came here for a "quick" breakfast with some girlfriends recently. 

I was planning on going into my office late, however this took a lot longer than I thought. They do warn you that making your meal could take up to 45 minutes, but since it was so slow I didn't think it would. It did. Making an egg sandwich does not take 45 mintues, I'm sorry. However, all of the food was fantastic. If I have more time I would definitely come back.

The back patio is adorable. This is the kind of place that you take a book too, or your laptop if you have some work to do. Hang out for awhile and enjoy the ambiance. The coffee is wonderful as well, I got a cafe latte. We were definitely a little confused if the food/coffee was going to brought to us or not, and the cashier wasn't very friendly. Overall service and preparation time was not impressive, but it was delicious and I loved the ambiance, therefore 3 stars it is.
author: Mandy A.

description:
The other week I came in for a couple of coffees straight from a a run and all I had was a credit card. There were no signs that indicated Blue Fig was cash-only. I waited in a pretty significant line only to be told credit cards were not accepted. Great.

It's 2016... There's really no reason to be cash only. Forfeiting 2.75% per transaction along with the occasional chargeback is the cost of doing business nowadays. Raise your prices bit.
author: Evan M.

description:
We tried to go to another place a block away for brunch but they were closed fro the Christmas break. We were hungry and in a hurry, so didn't have a back up plan and ended up here. Mistake #1

We ordered a croque monsier and a blue waffle with fig puree.  We ordered 1 coffee, she rang up 2 (mistake #2).

We got our silverware and brought it back to the table, knives were filthy with eggy bits. Then I got 2 more, (different scum, on 2nd set. 3rd and final set in the canister and yup, they were also dirty. I told the gal at the register and I heard her bitching to  her co-worker that she'd have to soak them.  

(While we were waiting for our food 2 other couples ordered at the counter, and they also had to correct there order with her, and she rang up incorrect items.  (what mistakes are we on, 3,4, or 5? 

Our table was super wobbly - not great in what is basically a coffee shop and your coffee spills.  Our food came and it was ok, nothing great.  

SKIP it, unless all you want is coffee with a lid and free wifi
author: Amy W.

description:
Good food, bad service. 

(Or 4 star food, 2 star service.)

I've been to Blue Fig on at least 3 different occasions. The first time was at Sunday Streets in the Mission District. The place was very crowded because of the event. I ordered a turkey sandwich with a side salad and my friend ordered the blue cornmeal waffle. Both were good, but nothing particularly special. You pay what you get for. 

When I started working in the Mission, I decided to go to lunch at Blue Fig because it's relatively affordable for the area. I ordered a croque provencal, which was very delicious. However, even with only 5 or 6 patrons in the cafe (most only ordering coffee), I felt like my meal took forever. Instead of making my food right away, they prioritized refilling the silverware and other menial tasks that could've waited.  

I went there last week and with only 1 customer in front of me, it took 20 minutes to make a 5 minute meal. Instead of helping the cook, the cashier was really antsy to take a smoke break. He seemed really distracted when he took my order. After 15 minutes of waiting for my meal, I checked on the kitchen, and they just started my order. I understand it takes time to cook, but c'mon, these people seem almost lazy. 

So Blue Fig, 3 strikes your out. I don't think I'll come here for lunch again...I don't have the time. I know the food is delicious, but I would rather spend the extra $2 for better service.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Pretty alright coffee stop on Valencia. To be honest, it's big draw is that it opens early, even on weekends. The staff was pretty nice and I drank bag tea, so I can't comment on their coffee and pastries.

The staff was friendly, but do keep in mind that it's cash only (like many spots in the Mission).
author: Irina P.

description:
The Blue Fig is a small café on Valencia. There are a few small tables in front of shop, inside the cafe, and out in the patio. A very casual atmosphere with a friendly staff. 

My friend and I came on a beautiful Saturday afternoon for brunch. The place was pretty crowded throughout our entire stay. We indulged in coffee and their breakfast bites.

Croque Madame (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-blue-fig-san-francisco?select=d4QHJysw_WI06y-7C4g4gA#nVi9RfpSgXq1OCkophsMTA): a ham and gruyere sandwich served with béchamel and over easy egg. We found this to be hearty and delicious. There was the perfect amount of ham and cheese and the egg was cooked perfectly. 

Blue Corn Waffle (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-blue-fig-san-francisco?select=d4QHJysw_WI06y-7C4g4gA#HKOIqLtg9f780JHOouonGg):  blue corn meal waffle with bananas, blueberries, whipped cream and fig reduction. The waffle was a bit too healthy for our taste. The blue corn meal created a more dense waffle. Still the fresh fruits, fig reduction and whipped cream made a delicious combination. 

The food was nothing out of the ordinary, but we did enjoy the atmosphere. Will revisit.
author: Marti L.

description:
This place was fairly grungy. I did like their outdoor patio/seating area.

Honestly, I came in here because I desperately need to use the restroom. I did order a drink because I believe in reciprocation and promoting businesses if I were to use their amenities. However, I didn't like the service one bit. The baristas looked spent and not at all eager to meet costumers. That factors equates to the 2 stars docked off. I would much rather visit another cafe 2-3 blocks away if I ever needed the restroom than to spend money here again. 

overall, it was allll right...
author: Bern M.

description: You will need to wait for your food. It is made to order and there are only 1-2 employees working at a time. Just relax! The oatmeal is delicious, the waffle is delicious, the side potatoes are so yummy. Also they make a real cappuccino with all foam- I really appreciate that.
author: Anita E.

description:
Blue fig is meh... at best. Trust the previous reviews when they say the wait is long, although they do warn you up front with a sign saying it's because all their food is freshly prepared. 

I ordered the egg sandwich, and replaced the ham with tomato (subbing ham for avocado was going to be an additional up charge). I also got a latte, which was cold by the time my food came out. The coffee was decent, and well priced. I think this place is better for just grabbing coffee in the morning. 

The outdoor patio is nice though, and they do have wifi. It could be a good place to read or meet up with a friend.
author: Trena M.

description: Walked in excited for their food, was then told that it was cash only and to use their ATM. They canceled the order and my large  group of people walked out of the establishment.
author: Conor E.

description:
3.5 stars 

First visit: two orders of croque madame to-go, which held up really well until we reached our destination. Delicious except for the amount of stone-ground mustard was slightly overwhelming. We munched on fresh-out-of-the-oven salted chocolate chip cookies while we waited for our order -- chocolate to cookie batter ratio was almost even. Friendly service from our male cashier. Still, I vowed not to come back because The Blue Fig is a cash-only establishment. 

But we did go back. 

Second visit: brunch on their back patio. Improved croque madam, mustard quantity was noticeably dialed back. I ordered two eggs atop my breakfast sandwich & one came out over-medium like I requested, while the other oozed yellow all over my plate. Their lack of attention to detail ensures we won't be back. It took several tries before we found clean water glasses, & the utensils were also filthy. Brioche French toast was dense, I would not recommend. Interaction with our female cashier was cold. 

Casual cafe with a great patio space, but more misses than hits.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Really liked the backyard bit. Really confused by the greens salad that I got. Odd array of ingredients with a heap of cinnamon sugar dumped on top?
author: Linh D.

description:
After a disappointing brunch, I'm not sure when I'll be back. 

I just don't think it's worth waiting forever for mediocre food. To be fair, there is a sign explaining the small kitchen and the potential for a 15-30 minute wait. But our meals, which were on the same number, came out 15 minutes apart from one another which made it hard to enjoy our meal together without one of them getting cold. The food was pretty basic and unmemorable. They forgot our coffee orders as well and we had to remind them what we got.

The back patio is really nice, I'll give them that!
author: Sara M.

description:
I work near here so I often stop by for coffee or lunch. I really enjoy it but there are definitely pros & cons.

Pros:
- The egg sandwich - vegetarian & delicious! 
- The oatmeal & yogurt is also a go-to meal. You get exactly what you expect to get.
- They make all of the food to order so it's fresh
- They have outdoor seating - both in front and out back
- Wifi if you ask for password

Cons: 
- There are only a couple people working so it can take a long time to get your food
- Staff is usually nice but sometimes it's hit or miss. A couple times I could tell the two people working behind the counter did not like each other or were really annoyed.
- Service can be slow (even just to order) so not ideal if you're in a hurry
- Cash only which isn't always convenient

With that said, still my go-to coffee/snack shop in the area. It has above average food & a cute, homey feel.
author: Hailey H.

description:
Love the backyard! Sunny, potted plants, rustic feel. The food is good, 

Total for breakfast for two: $18. 

Remember to grab your own utensils, napkins, & water after you order at the counter.

* Egg Sandwich - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-blue-fig-san-francisco?select=F3QCW0WbflJTzeCO49pSUw#F3QCW0WbflJTzeCO49pSUw
(choice of ciabatta or bagel, boar's head bavarian ham, basil aioli and vermont white cheddar)
The ciabatta was actually really great - soft, fresh, light cruncy. The runny yolk on the egg was nice but be careful of the mess!

* Blue Waffle - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-blue-fig-san-francisco?select=F3QCW0WbflJTzeCO49pSUw#CunQnVsJwQE-n-n-3uuQcQ
(organic blue corn meal topped with fig reduction, house whipped cream, banana and syrup)
A little underwhelming. The waffle is pretty thin, and the texture not as grainy as I'd hoped for it being made of corn meal. The fig reduction was really, really sour - didnt' taste anything like figs! The strawberries weren't quite ripe and were a bit on the sour side too. At least they had banana & cream to add sweetness!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
The coffee is good and the sandwiches are great,
but I would not recommend the cookies
author: Levona C.

description:
This is my local cafe - I'm here 3 or 4 times a week. It's like a dive bar of coffee shops, but with surprisingly delicious small breakfast options. I've met the staff and they're all lovely people.

The food can be slow, especially on the weekends. They're cash only. Most staff members have an intense case of bitchy resting face syndrome. You have to come in here with proper expectations to enjoy the place, but I take lots of people here.
author: Joseph D.

description: Very clean, calm spot for a morning beverage and treat.  Staff is naturally friendly - on a recommendation from them, I enjoyed a glass of fresh orange juice and a delicious piece of cake.  The outside seating is perfect for people-watching, enjoying a beautiful day, and chatting with friends.
author: Matt B.

description:
I really like this place, it's not too gigantic, but it's big enough to settle a few people who just wanna sit and talk with friends, family, or a significant other while drinking a nice cup of coffee. The walls are adorned by local artists and their painting, which are absolutely marvelous to ponder at. Very nice smooth and classical music fill the place up too. Not too loud, not too soft.

The bf and i came here for a small brunch, and i'm glad to say that the food here is great. The roma sandwich ($6.50) is divine. I loved their combo of spinach and tomatoes with mozzarella cheese, alongside ham and egg. My bf ordered their baked french toast, and the bread was just so yummy. The crust had a crunch to it, not like most french toasts where it just gets so soggy. It also was drizzled in fruits, and it was just so nice. 

the only downside is that they only take cash. But nonetheless, a great place to grab a light meal for a decent price.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
The food here is delicious! I was looking for a spot for brunch on a Sunday with no wait in San Francisco.. Sounds impossible, but this was it! 

Prices are awesome, about $8 for a breakfast sandwich! I tried the croque madame and my boyfriend had the roma breakfast. Both were incredibly delicious and we cleaned the plate up. 

They have a small outdoor seating area in the back with a cute setting of succulents, plants, and simple lights all around. 


Loved the food, setting, and prices!
author: Natally A.

description: Bagels, coffee, tea and sandwiches, best way to start your day. Staff is very friendly and they even gave us some sample bars. They open at 6:30am Monday through Friday which is a great help. My favorite dish is  the egg sandwich ciabatta, boar's head bavarian ham, basil aioli and vermont white cheddar. They have a cozy outdoor seating patio and they also have outdoor seating outside. The only bad thing about this place is they only take cash and that parking is a pain.
author: Suzy R.

description: I just stopped by for an iced coffee...it was put simply the worst iced coffee I've ever had in my life. Tasted like the coffee had been sitting there for 3 days WITH the beans still in it. Maybe the food here is better but I won't be returning.
author: J. D.

description: The back patio area is 'charming' without trying to be charming, like they didn't get a bunch of restaurant consultants to figure out what to do with the back area. This cafe is a classic SF cafe, before Blue Bottle, Ritual, and Sight Glass came along and turned coffee into some wine tasting. They serve regular strong coffee. The cashiers, waitresses, and baristas are all classic-SF ladies: a few regrettable tattoos, they are poets or musicians or painters, smart, empowered, worldly, who don't shave their armpits, but are perhaps attracted to cruel emotionally unavailable men. Imagine Joan Didion without all the money she has, with a touch of Daria seen through the lens of The River's Edge. One slight problem before you think this place is a godsend: the ladies, being Joan Didion/Daria-types, are a bit 'frazzled' and it takes on the long side to get your order. And sometimes the order is wrong. And sometimes they have attitude. But this is America, and the free market tells the stories of winners, and I give my money to The Blue Fig. And who cares about details when the you're having a decent cup of medium roasted coffee in a back patio that reeks of an SF experience, like last weekend I was reading Book 2 of My Struggle and two couples sat at the table next to me, talking about some air mattress, on which, it was heavily implied, one of the couples slept. They were all attractive, their lids tugged downward in post-orgasmic lethargy, and so I imagined their art of rugged coitus as I toyed with a 50 euro cent that I had found under the table. I was brought a sandwich I didn't recall ordering, and told the silverware was in the front. I traced her retreat by looking at her buttocks, breathing in a faint waft of basil from my sandwich, which I conflated with her feminine funk. A pigeon came by, which I half-heartedly tried to kick, knowing I would fail. Seeing through me, as if gleaning my depression, it became fearless in my vicinity. It's tiny black eyes betrayed contempt. Seeing this hurt me. If you like it real, a place that feels like it has no time for consultants or therapy, come to The Blue Fig.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Warning! The blue waffles look better than they taste. But besides that, everything is on point! Affordable, tasty, & photo worthy to post on your Instagram/ Facebook. Lol.
author: Angie C.

description: I hate writing bad reviews for small businesses but this place really ticked me off. I came in around 11am for breakfast and while the line wasn't extremely long, I noticed it was taking FOREVER for orders to actually be taken. The cashier was simultaneously making lattes (spending time on the latte art) as she was taking orders. It took 30 minutes for the line to go through 4 people. Then another 40 minutes to get our food. By the time it was ready we literally had to leave to get to our next appointment so I had them box it for us. All we got were two open face egg sandwiches. Nothing fancy, with avocado and basil. I could have made it at home in 20 minutes. The bread tasted stale & the eggs were already cold. Such an annoying experience :(
author: Naseem K.

description:
I wouldn't go here for a nice breakfast. The food is very mediocre. 

+ outdoor seating
- waiter wrote down the wrong order. he also seemed to be having a bad day. i got a free cookie though for the mistake
author: Margaret R.

description:
A free wifi cafe with ample seating - awesomeness. Check out the patio space in the back. Tables and seats also available inside and in front. 

Cute space, friendly faces and decent menu. Ordered the Blue Cornmeal Waffle - nothing to be crazy about (waffle + fig jam + few banana slices + whipped cream). Too $$ for my wallet. IDK what I was thinking... ordering a $7 (mediocre) waffle for myself.
author: Suji C.

description: I visited one morning and had the egg sandwich and a hot chocolate. My friend ordered the quinoa salad. Our meal arrived to our table with a normal wait time. I say this because I noticed a lot of reviews stating excessive wait time but again if you go during a brunch time you shouldn't expect immediate service. It was too cold to try the back yard seating but will return another warm day to do so. My experience was good, the staff was attentive and the food was well prepared. I will come back to try the French toast. I am not a big croque fan but most everyone seemed to order it so it must be good if that's your thing.
author: Roje D.

description:
About the place: Super cute with a great patio out front and back. WiFi also. On the patio out back there was a family with kids and also a guy painting his friends portrait -- pretty cool scene. The point is the space is versatile. 

About the food: the food is pricey but I was pleasantly surprised because it is good. I think maybe I went in with the expectation of it being just a coffee shop but it wound up having a nicer restaurant feel so to speak. The almond croissant is impeccable as is the Ruben. The Ruben comes with a salad and unfortunately we found a dead Rolly Polly (cute little insect) in ours. Not a deal breaker they have an excellent health rating and hey, it's certainly organic. 

About the service: I'm from the East Coast and have noticed that in particular coffee shops have poor service. There was a young man there that day who looked like he could care less about what we ordered or when we ordered it. Restaurants grossly underestimate service, customer loyalty and word of mouth here. A lot of times even if your food isn't the best if your customer service kicks ass, I'm in. I was so turned off by the lack of service that I'm not sure I would go back. I wonder what folks are asked in the interview process here. I'd love to sit in on one because if you aren't passionate about service and about your customers you won't last -- or rarely last I should say. AND you should hire folks who love their job as much as you do. Again it was one person in particular, the two ladies seemed very nice etc. 

About the price: latte w/extra shot, Ruben (comes with side salad) and almond croissant for $22.
author: Neal B.

description:
Breakfast Sandwhich: GOOD
Coffee: GOOOOD
Mason jar game: GOOOD
Breakfast potatoes: GOOD
Atmosphere and outside seating: GOOOOD
Friendly and helpful staff: GOOOOOD
author: Kelly W.

description:
Blue Fig is a cute cafe with lots of seating (indoors and outdoors - in front and the back patio) and free wifi. It looks like a great place to sit, hang out, do some work on your laptop.

I ordered a regular coffee, which tasted okay. I also ordered the blue cornmeal waffle (since I saw so many pictures of it online!). It's basically a big waffle with fig jam, banana slices and whipped cream on top. Maple syrup on the side. It was pretty good at the beginning.. but then it started to taste real dry after a while. Probably a good size to share with a friend. 

Anyway, I'm still giving it four stars.. mostly because of its ambiance and free wifi!
author: Cassy H.

description:
Things I love about the place: 

1. Cute Courtyard: there is a cute courtyard in the back of the restaurant. Not too much sun. There is even a plug for your laptop if you sit by the walk in certain spot.

2. Outdoor sitting: couple two-three people sitting in front of the restaurant.

3. Tasty Food: my vegetarian sandwich is very tasty with balsamic marinated portobello mushroom & roasted red bell pepper. French Toast is delicious with huge whipped cream and couple sliced banana & strawberry on top. Spicy pecan off set the sweetness of the syrup. Perfect balance.

4. Good Coffee: better than avg. Latte. Good quality. 

5. Price: it's $25.00 w/tips for two beverage & two plates. It's not too bad. 

Things are ok here:

1. Tea selection is so so- just regular Mighty-Leaf organic tea bags. It's acceptable, but no loose tea leaf for a tea lover.

2. Service: I'm not sure if I suppose to clean my own table. The waitress was not very friendly when I asked for internet password. It's not big deal. I thought the local coffee shop people are nicer than the regular chained one. 

3. Menu: not a lot of selection for sandwiches, but enough for a coffee shop

Overall is good: Solid 3-3.5 stars

I will definitely stop by for a cup of coffee next time when I'm in the neighborhood. But I probably will not come back for brunch or make a special trip just for it.
author: Candy C.

description:
The macchiato I received was luke warm. It tasted like a day old shot of espresso. Cash only location, which makes it trying. Tables were rocky and the barista/cook was so so, in terms of service. This was at 6:30 a.m., Wednesday morning. After she took back the macchiato, I heard the microwave go on.

Not impressed.
author: John M.

description:
Coffee shop with quality egg sandwiches, French toast, croque Madame. #restaurantreview #sanfrancisco

I'd give this place 3 stars as a restaurant, since the food is good but not spectacular. As a coffee shop though, 4 stars is about right. Outdoor patio with seating and some tables/chairs inside. 

Cash only.
author: Nikki S.

description: The cash only thing is really frustrating, and their ATM charges $2.50. I basically keep cash on me just for when I come here, I don't think there's anything else in my daily life I need it for. Other than that this place is nice, food is decent and all but one of the staff I've met were friendly.
author: Rich L.

description: Enjoyed sitting out on the sidewalk for an ice-cold coffee on a hot afternoon, enjoying their wifi and watching my fella eat a yummy looking quinoa salad. Wished I had known about their sunny back patio area. It was away from the traffic, was quiet and looked like people were having fun sitting in the sun and working on their computers.
author: Jane L.

description:
In a city that likes to wait in line for awesome little cafe's that brew coffee by the gram and serve local, organic food that was hand-picked by Tibetan monks, this is a gem.

Don't get me wrong, I love food hand-picked by Tibetan monks just as much as the next guy in line, but I'm not one to wait 2 hour to be seated. The Blue Fig is just as good as many of those places, but the hipsters must not have found it yet, because there's never an endless line and always a place to sit. 

Pro tip: Checkout the back patio.

They have a short menu of food and, so far, everything I've had is excellent. My favorite things are the roma sandwich, egg sandwich and the bruschetta with tomato tapenade. 

The coffee is very good, but I wouldn't call it amazing.

Overall a solid place!

Note: They are cash only, but they have an ATM inside.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I wanted to get breakfast for my sister and I, with two cups of coffee -- the total came up to about $22, I took out my card, and saw the sign, cash only. I had only $15 on me, so couldn't get the food. I spent $14 instead of $22. 

There is no reason this place should be cash only. With credit card processing cost at 3% + $0.30 (see Stripe), the transaction cost would have been just about a $1. So instead of taking my $22 and making $19 out of it with the transaction cost subtracted, they went with the modal of charging me $14.

Now, you could argue that not everyone is going to purchase $22 meal, but that's why there exists a minimum credit card purchase i.e. minimum $8 to use card.  I have been here total of 3 times, and all three times, I ended up attempting to purchase $20+ meal, and ended up spending less.

Way to go boss!

P.S. you could also argue that they are making more profit by paying less taxes on minimized reported profit, but I would rather make more money and pay more tax, then make less money and pay no tax.
author: Zorayr K.

description:
Look, the food is good. But the time it takes to prepare it is absurd. They say upfront that there's a wait to receive food, but it doesn't excuse how long I've had to wait on a couple of occasions- five minutes for a cappuccino when no other orders were up, and over 50 minutes for a breakfast sandwich which only consisted of eggs and cheese. It seems like the food service could be streamlined, or they just need to offer items that don't take them almost an hour to make - the employees weren't slacking at all, but it still took them excessively long to complete orders.

The food is solid - I've had the vegetarian lunch sandwich and would recommend it, while their breakfast sandwich is pretty mediocre - but if you want to order, be prepared for a very lengthy wait.
author: Justin S.

description:
My first experience of the Blue Fig. I love it. I'm coming back all the time!
I'm having their egg sandwich on focaccia and the bread is perfect, the sandwich is the best sandwich my brain could imagine.  on this morning of being hung over from a night out at another gallery, my soul needs healing.  The sandwich has done it.  It is also perfectly conducive to my writings about what kind of art to make next. Also I have a mason jar mug for my cold chai. 
Barista was happy and chipper. I love it.
author: Gillian K.

description:
It's a nice place.  Coffee isn't the best in the world, and I wouldn't even say that it gets the job done, but if you have some light work to do, or if you want to catch up with friends, Blue Fig is a great neighborhood spot on the weekends.  It's just far enough from Dolores Park so that people aren't crowding the area on a sunny day.  

There are a lot of tables, which is great for studying.  You'll be in close quarters, but seriously?  We live in a city, so you should be used to that.

I wish I had tried some of the food because it looked SO good.  

Sadly, it is cash only, but so are a ton of other places in the area ;(
author: Jennifer L.

description:
A very nice,  local find.  The outside sign and decor give hints to a very unique experience, which really rounds it off with the awesome outside seating area in the back.  The service was decent,  although they got my dad's drink order wrong.  

What really made the experience for me was the most important part: the food.  Their espresso was very good.  It was very well made and balanced,  having a matured fruit taste after initial cocoa taste.  The Madame  Croque was amazing.  It's an open faced sandwich with ham,  egg,  and a cheese sauce.  The ingredient that rounded it out was the whole seed mustard  in between the bread.  Delicious.
author: Nathan C.

description:
(See pics) Review #1245. Local cafe that serves good breakfast. Roma breakfast was with simple fresh basil leaves, tomatoes,ham and a fried egg. It was a good morning call (even my brunch usually starts at 2pm.) My friend had theCroque Madam and it looked mighty good too.

They use a local coffee brewery and I do like it quite a bit, earthy and nice aroma.

While it has some indoor small cafe tables and an parklet, I really enjoy the patio in the back that was quiet without the traffic.

Service was a bit slow on the day we visited as they have 1 person taking orders and was also making drinks. But it's also Labour Day so I am just grateful that someone was making the breakfast! And they were uber friendly.
author: T L.

description:
I love this place!

Roma Breakfast - heavenly! fresh ingredients and perfectly cooked egg with a runny yolk! Love that!

Blue Waffles - why can't I have this every Sunday?!!? I would drive up again for this place. The fig preserve drizzled over it was lovely and light with the bananas and light whipped cream. Seriously delicious! 

The coffee was superb! I really enjoyed it and my partner loved the Masala Chai. 

The seating was fine for us, did not have to fight for a table or wait in a long line to order. Maybe we got lucky on a Saturday morning. Got to sit outside under the romantic SF overcast sky and enjoy our delectable coffee and breakfast. 

I would definitely go back to this location on my next trip up. Hope the seating gods will still be smiling down on me. :)
author: Nahid D.

description: Worst service. The guy in the front doesn't seem to give a shit. Its been over 30 minutes and the food still hasn't arrived yet. They are just standing around on their phones. Waste if time.
author: Chris N.

description:
One of our go-to work spots in the Mission, especially if it's a nice day--back patio, woo! They serve boss Dough & Co chocolate chip cookies, and my brother and his roommate tell me the almond lattes are awesome.

My only quibbles: cash only, and there weren't many outlets on the patio. Only one table, as far as I can tell, has access to the outlets.
author: Amanda P.

description: Best Croque i've had this side of the atlantic. Nice, chill cafe.
author: Leo D.

description:
Great coffee, but prepare to wait if you want to eat. There is no sense of urgency here. The service took foreeeever because the guy taking the order was also the bus boy and deliverer of food. 

On top of this, he really really took his time. I think I waited at the front of the line for 10 minutes while he was doing random thing.

Stick with coffee and a pastry when you come here.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Seriously... Waited for over 30 minutes. Then when I kindly asked the waitress about the status of our order, she acted beyond bitchy. We watched meal after meal get delivered to the people all around us.

When they finally brought our food, the waitress clarified that we had only waited for 30 minutes. She made the point because I had told her we waited for 40 minutes. At that point, what does it matter?!

Bottom line: if you have already had your breakfast and you are no longer hungry, come eat here. If you don't mind rude servers, and you have a stomach for adversity, come here.
author: Philip C.

description:
#51

Maybe it was what I ordered that was the problem.. I got the salad on top of a waffle with some mushroom mix in the middle (so sorry- i totally forgot the name) but for me personally it wasn't as appetizing as I was hoping it would be. The mushroom mix was bland and the waffle soggy. 

My friend got the ham and guyere cheese on an open faced sandwich and WHATEVER else was on there was DELICIOUS. There was a pesto garlicky aioli type spread that made my mouth water. I highly recommend THAT. I wanted to eat his as I was slightly disappointed with my own order. I had just hopped off a 5 hour flight from the east coast and was dying for a delicious meal. 

To top it off the servers behind the counter were not very friendly. And it took over half an hour to get our order. This place clearly gives a diner/cafe bordering fast food place feel and the amount of time it took to wait for your food did not match the ambiant feel it gave off. 

If you just happen to be at this place and need advice on what to get, go for that open faced ham and cheese sandwich.  Other than that, it would be hard to recommend coming here for anything else.
author: Mari A.

description:
This is my To-Go place if the nearby Ritual coffee is overcrowded, or if I need real food when working. This is an excellent place to park with your laptop.

Pros:
--- free, fast, reliable wifi
--- plenty of outlets, seats never full despite being small
--- actual food like salad & sandwiches

Cons:
--- cash only
--- closes early
--- no hipster decor or fancy coffee for those of you who care
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Reliable brunch option. 

This place is good for an easy sandwich... they have pretty good food and there is wifi. I have not yet been blown away by anything, but it's a solid go to.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This place is my go-to for breakfast (which really can happen at any time of day. ;) The girl that owns it is the absolute SWEETEST, along with the rest of the amazing staff! Their bagel and egg sandwiches, and steel cut oats are all delicious, and they're always happy to do their best to accommodate gluten free folks. Plus they have a lovely little kid-friendly backyard that's nice and cool on those hot days. And now a gorgeous parklet in the front!

I LOVE BLUE FIG!!!
author: jessica k.

description:
Imagine what a place called "The Blue Fig" would be like, and it was exactly that. It's a cute cafe with free wifi, a good selection of lunch dishes, and an outdoor parklet out front.

I got the quinoa salad, which was delicious with just the right amount of dressing and a tasty combination of fresh vegetables. My friend got the eggplant sandwich, which she also enjoyed.
author: Katie B.

description:
+ Sunny front perch for people watching on Valencia Street
+ Funky quiet back patio
+ Nice staff
+ Decent menu
+ Free Wifi ! 

- Cash Only
- Coffee is not Ritual Coffee, which is 1/2 block away (no-one can really compete with it!).
- Can get really backed up and crowded if you are in a hurry.
author: Best M.

description:
Holy macchiato, Batman!

I was ecstatic after my wonderful meal here. Constance D. and I randomly wandered in here looking for a nice breakfast and tasty espresso one Saturday morning. I munched on the ever so tasty Croque Madame in all of its béchamel goodness.

It was fantastic! Everything melded together so well. The gruyère and ham went great with the whole grain mustard. That egg on top was perfect when I sliced through the yolk and it spilled all over the bread. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

The coffee was tasty and the ambiance was comfortable. I'm going back next time I'm in the Mission.


Cash only, yo. ATM with $2.50 fee. (Wells Fargo @ 22nd & Mission)
author: Justin C.

description: I needed a caffeine pick me up and The Blue Fig was the perfect stop for my craving! I ordered an iced soy latte and had to grab a vegan ginger cookie because it looked so darn good in the display case. Both were excellent and I love that they have a back patio with outdoor seating! What a cool change from your typical coffee shop! Nice place with good coffee!!
author: Sheena T.

description:
This cafe was a good spot to have a cup of joe and get some work done as they have Wifi, but it was going in and out when I was there. 

The staff was hum-drum not too pleasant, not grumpy either. 

I had the Croque Madame and it was pretty up to par, tasted like those in France. The white mocha was good too.

It's a hum-drum spot.
author: Alyssa R.

description: So I just ordered an ice coffee. It tasted like cleaning products from Cancun and hippy ball sweat. The guy was nice enough to replace it with the regular coffee and ice. I don't recommend the ice coffee here.
author: Alex A.

description:
I was a little bugged by, "The Blue Fig."   They serve delicious food but also served up a lot of small fruit flies too.  It was bad and they were everywhere.  I thought my sandwich was delicious and the lady working was really kind but I could not go back here unless they fumigated.  I know they won't be happy when they read this but unfortunately it was that bad.  

Call Pied Piper or the Orkin Man for goodness sakes...lol
author: Brian S.

description: I like this place a lot, Love the Iced Coffee, and LOVE the egg sandwich.... my go to.  The back patio is a nice little hide away during the summer. The staff is super nice!! This is my favorite coffee shop around the area.
author: Candace P.

description: A Hidden gem in Valencia. Great coffee and breakfast. Might be little constraint on the space but definitely worth the money.
author: Art T.

description:
Okay, so...

Whilst looking for new and great places to try, I found this on Yelp (strangely enough ;)).  Regretfully, I wasn't too impressed...

Ambiance:  It's a simple enough cafe, but I found that the purpose is lost.  Is it a cafe, or is it a restaurant?  Can it be both?  I'm not sure, but I encourage the Blue Fig to pick one...

Service:  You never really interact with them besides ordering.  The girl at the front, for her credit, was super nice -- I had seen online that the barristas here make shapes out of the coffee.  On my trip (of course) the barrista who could do that was out that day, so no such luck.  Still, the girl that WAS working agreed to try for me -- she made me a simple heart, so I was happy.

Food:  I think that the best thing that they served me here was the coffee.  I tried their "3 Piece Bruschetta Sampler" and it was awful.  Next I split the "Savory Waffle" with a friend, and again, it was pretty awful.  When I think of both of those things, well, let's just say that what I expected was not what I got.  Lastly we split the Ham and Gruyère sandwich.  This was pretty much the reason that my review was a 1.5 and not a 1.  It was exceptional, such that I encourage the Blue Fig to make more items like this (maybe focus entirely on over the top stuff, rather than the aforementioned, underwhelming sampler), and I bet you'd get a lot more word of mouth traffic.

For my part, I don't think I'll go back without a major menu shakeup.
author: Bryan H.

description: Stopped for an afternoon double-shot and pastry. Good espresso, good cake, prompt and friendly service. Customers stuck in screens at tables so it was nice and quiet inside. Altogether just what we were after.
author: Jim L.

description: I honestly really liked The Blue Fig, I don't understand the stigma that accompanies a three star review -- it's really a solid place! I chose The Blue Fig for Saturday morning brunch because I was just not in the mood to wait an hour to dine at another place. I ordered the Reuben - pastrami with sauerkraut, basil aoili, and gruyere cheese on rye  bread. The sandwich was solid - good pastrami and toppings, the only thing I would change is to have the bread toasted... but that's seriously just a first world problem. My friends ordered a Reuben as well and a Croque Madam, they were both pleased with their choices. Their entire menu had very reasonable prices (compared to all the other outrageously overpriced restaurants popping up all over the Mission lately).To top it all off the service was great and the weather was so beautiful that we got to sit outside in the little parklet. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who was looking for a new low-key/no-wait kind of brunch.
author: Elaine N.

description: This was probably the worst service I have ever experienced from a "Coffee" shop. The drinks were watered down and not worth it at all. It's cash only and the environment feels dirty and in welcoming
author: Sasha S.

description: Waffle and French toast took 1 hour to be placed on my table from time ordered.  It was expensive and not worth waiting for. Waffle was a bit soggy. French toast was nice. Coffee was bland. Wait staff was not friendly.
author: Byron L.

description:
Pretty solid spot in the mission. They also have an outdoor area in the back.

Free wifi, pretty decent sandwiches, good coffee, plenty of tables (but only a few outlets). Great place to come and get some work done and, better yet, to be seen typing away on your macbook air.
author: Andy J.

description: The Blue Fig was decent. not sure that I'll be back again though. Not a huge breakfast menu, a little pretentious and CASH ONLY. I had the French Toast - not really normal french toast, not bad just not amazing. It is like french toast that has been put in a toaster oven after it was cooked, crispy and kind of hard on the outside. My friend had the waffle which was pretty good. Coffee was ok.
author: Mackensie M.

description:
After passing by and eyeing the Blue Waffle one afternoon, we returned the next day to try it. Though there was only one person in front of me in line, I ended up waiting nearly 10 minutes to order. Not sure if they were understaffed or just running behind (the cashier was also manning the espresso machine), but I was on the verge of giving up and walking out. When the girl finally did take my order, she strangely didn't even mention/apologize for the lengthy wait.

We sat on the pleasant patio, which has at least 3 tables that are so warped or slanted they can hardly even be called tables anymore. But the food came out fast, and it was about as tasty as we had hoped (waffle was a bit crispy, but fruit on top was ripe and sweet).
author: David Z.

description:
I'm a bit disappointed. When I read reviews, I had expectations. The menu was small and somewhat limited to my always-expanding appetite. Nothing really appealed to me, but I felt somewhat compelled to stick to eating here to play catch-up with a friend. 

I ordered the ham, egg and cheese croquet, except no cheese for me. What??! I know, I was wondering if it was pasteurized and they didn't know, so I didn't chance it, so yeah.

It was ok. It was palatable with my hot chocolate. My friend devoured her blue waffle and liked it a lot, so I guess I can't complain. 

I did, however, LOOOOVE the design they artfully placed on my hot chocolate. It said, "LOVE LIFE." I do and it was nice to see.
author: Sharon B.

description:
I went there for the first time for brunch with my wife and baby. It was as drizzly day in SF and the inside dining was full. There were seats outside in back and front but, were all wet. WE ordered the Roma Breakfast and the Madame Croque with 2 small coffees. WE were a but disappointed we were not able to get a seat inside with our baby even though there were people taking up space inside who clearly finished their food a while ago and were just using the wifi.  

WE went to the back patio which is charming although it was wet and wished they had some sort of awning or portable parasol. When the food arrived it was delicious and no complaints on the taste or presentation. The portions were a bit on the smaller side for me but, I can eat a lot. The 2 of us were very please with the food and would return again except on a dry day.

2 meals and 2 coffee was under $20 good deal!
author: rico c.

description: Excellent hot chocolate and masala chai! Friendly barista. Free WiFi. In the heart of The Mission district.
author: Anna Maria M.

description:
Love how the meals are cooked on a hot plate in the makeshift kitchen in this friendly cafe. The blue corn waffle came with a generous serving of whipped cream, strawberries and bananas. I didn't touch the syrup but it was a tasty breakfast.

Nice little patio area is good for summer days.
author: Angie C.

description: I like how affordable and unpretentious this place is. and yes it has wifi even on weekends while a lot other coffee shops nearby don't.  BUT - they could clean their tables a lot more...if you come here, it is for the accepting yet mediocre vibe, not quality service or cleanliness.
author: Shuting Z.

description: I don't normally give bad Yelp reviews, but we ordered two egg sandwiches to-go nearly 40 minutes ago and we're still waiting for them. I know they have a sign at the front warning that their food is all freshly prepared and therefore takes a while, but 40 minutes for a very simple dish is excessive. The staff is busy and on task, so it's likely an effect of having too few workers and too many menu items. Won't be returning here in subsequent visits to the Mission, unfortunately.
author: John M.

description:
Delicious egg sandwich with aged Vermont white cheddar, house made basil aioli, on a herbed focaccia roll. I substituted California avocado for the sandwich's standard Bavarian ham. 

The substitution didn't advantage me in price, though - the $5.95 sandwich just became about $8. 

It took a little while to make do order, but it was really tasty - all the ingredients were quite fresh.

Didn't try the coffee, but they had a full menu.
author: Christian S.

description:
Nice cafe, casual atmosphere, indoor & outdoor seating. There was no wait when we arrived and they were pretty quick with the food and drinks. My white mocha was perfect, and my friends chai latte was good (on the spicy side). It's small, and you can see the guys cooking/making your food, which I think is pretty cool. 

Prices were good. My sandwich with a small side salad was 8.50 and my mocha was 3.50 I think. We both paid around $10-11 for our food and drink.

4 stars because it was good and I will definitely go back, but it wasn't super special. It was also cash only, which is fine, but I prefer to use my card. The guy also forgot about my mocha until I asked him for it. Which is completely fine, I understand that people make mistakes, so it was really no big deal.
author: Severin W.

description: Just had a breakfast bagel. The most delicious breakfast bagel I have ever had outside of my mom's kitchen. Wow. Was not expecting so much flavor!!
author: Alejandro V.

description: The white mocha is amazing and the croque madame is mouthwatering. The first bite is rich and has the right consistency of crunchy and savory. Nothing I felt was overbearing. The egg sandwich may look and sound simple but the taste has an edge with the garlic butter spread. Enjoy your visit!
author: Nikole D.

description:
Best breakfast sandwich in the city, hands down. 

The basil aioli is incredible (hint: you can add it to pretty much anything on the menu.) The pastrami and turkey sandwiches are also really good. Highly recommended!
author: Mehul T.

description: Great iced coffee and breakfast. I had the egg sandwich with ham and cheese substituted for veggies. I'd give it 5 stars if they weren't cash only.
author: Jeremiah L.

description: Slow service. A-ok food. It was nice to sit outside n drink coffee. Good place for coffee n coffee cake & laptop ;) coffee cake was good. We also had Reuben sandwich and croque Provençal .
author: C A.

description:
Stop #1 on my Mission Food Crawl with Vivek A. and Mehul T.

Food:
+Breakfast Sandwich, no meat- didn't care for the overdosing of tomatos on there. tomatos on top of bread and egg makes it soggy and overwhelming.
+ Breakfast sandwich, with ham- this one was better but i think the cheese/aoili took care of that

Ambience:
Cafe style with plenty of seating.

Service:
Friendly but you order at the front, get your own food, and bus your own tables. Ain't nothin wrong with a little self-serve though.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Hidden back patio is DEFINITELY where you should sit!  (Not many outlets back there, though, if you're going to do work.  Hang out in the front if that's the plan.  The back is for tranquil hanging.)  The greek yogurt is legit.  And great coffee.

Cash only!
author: Holly O.

description:
Good teas, nice little treats. 
BUT :
the lady is not happy to work here, you can tell by her unfriendly attitude, it feels like you are really bothering her when you come and order something. The music is pretty awful as well :( 
Also, don't go there if you are looking for a place to concentrate to work, music there is too loud and not appropriate. 
There is way better places in the city .
author: Marion P.

description: The food is tasty and very reasonably priced. The staff is friendly. Great place to work from.
author: Stephane D.

description: Cute place in a cute area. The food takes a long time to prepare and the portions are kind of small but it tastes good. I didn't think it was particularly outstanding but I enjoyed my breakfast. I got a Croque Madame, which is basically an egg and ham on toast, made delicious by whole grain mustard and this creamy sauce.
author: Catherine C.

description:
***** FINE CUISINE UNDER $10 *****

I love this place (food and atmosphere)

The food:  Excellent ingredients.  Cooked (not microwaved) as you order it.  Tastes wonderful.   

Customer care: I am treated as if I'm the most important customer at the moment.  I leave feeling special.  This type of customer service gets rewarded by my regular attendance.  

Atmosphere: When the word gets out how fantastic Blue Fig is there will be a line out the door and worth every minute wait.  Sure a couple of tables are close to the ordering counter... I would sit there happily!  

Keep up the great work Fig... I look forward to seeing you again soon!
author: Domenic F.

description: Blue Fig is my go to cafe, even though Ritual is closer to my house.  Coffee is flavorful and strong.  Food is also delicious!  Love their garden patio or the parklet serves for good people watching on a sunny day.  Try their Irish Oats it's not just the standard oatmeal.
author: Jackie L.

description:
This place is a great stop for on the go coffee and snacks and a  sit-in place. The service on the other hand was not so great. I came here with one other person the cashier (sporting red lipstick) was not friendly at all and I could read it on her face. I still decided to speak and she didn't really acknowledge that. RUDE Bitch!! She also managed to get my order wrong, which was probably done on purpose after I decided to show I can give 10x more Sas. (I really hate bad customer service and I will let the individual giving it know either by word or again my 10x more SAS). After telling her my meal was wrong she didn't want to believe it but she did give me the meal I did order. I also don't like when restaurants throw out good food because of wrong orders I'm sure there was someone on the corner who would have appreciated her mistake. 

I made a YELP account just to post this. This situation occurred late March/2015
author: Pedro W.

description:
It was really bad. The service is really mediocre, the employes are not helpful at all, I went there with my family and we tried to get some chairs for us and even when they saw us come in, they didn't even say hello, the tables had leftovers from other people and the chairs were dirty and greasy . The food disappointing! my sister got a waffle which was pretty disgusting it felt like those frozen waffles that you can make at home which some sauce not sweet at all, bland, hard outside and difficult to eat for like 9 dollars come on!.
The egg sandwich that my mom ate nothing special at all, same thing bland, melted cheese everywhere.
My turkey sandwich what a waste of money and time was gross and the salad that comes with it just lettuce, the one that you can easily get in costco with a crapy pink dressing. When I came back home I was really sick and I vomit the whole night.

It's really difficult to write this because I usually see the bright side of the things but OMG you guys didn't care and what I really hated was that horrible service, stand up and help your costumers! clean that place its not even big! 

The tray of dirty dishes next to our table! bring it inside the kitchen and watch it! I don't get how you guys have 4 stars... seriously!
author: Gill L.

description: I really liked this place! Good seating, nice atmosphere, good coffee smells. Not too busy on a Saturday evening. Free wifi. I will be back! Cash only.
author: Kate L.

description:
A tasty and tasteful lunch spot in my favorite part of Valencia.

The place has a really warm vibe. A nice little message on the wall about enjoying your life and friends seemed to summarize the atmosphere they're going for. The displayed art and photos are interesting but not pretentious or obnoxious. Very amiable staff.

I was blown away by the turkey on wheat, which I only picked to go on the safe side. I also really liked the blue waffle, especially because they give you the option to add a ramekin of Canadian maple syrup with it.

However, my favorite item is probably 'Our Reuben' which is aptly named since they add a basil aioli to the classic sandwich.  Having tried my friend's reuben the first time we went here, I had to come back and have my own reuben with extra aioli.

The owner is a really nice guy and seems to know quite a bit about food. He comes up with a special every other week. The bread pudding looked pretty good.

I'll admit, I wasn't too impressed with how this place ran a few weeks ago. Service was slow and the staff, though friendly, didn't seem to know the whole menu yet. Coming back here recently, things seem a lot smoother and more efficient, despite what appeared to be a larger lunch crowd.

I hope they open that back patio, it looks quite spacious but it's closed off.  In any case, I will definitely come back here. Might try the croque madame.
author: John C.

description: My creative mentor and I had a leisurely, joyous lunch on the sunny back porch. The service was great. When my friend needed a salad ingredient omitted, the barista said, "We mix them up fresh, so no problem!" The food was delicious and indeed, fresh. I couldn't help overhearing the writers discussing their novels at the table nearby. That made me feel welcome, like this is a good writer-hangout café. Though the porch was lively, the tiny indoor part seemed quiet and perfect for working. I'll be back to do some writing here.
author: Kristy L.

description:
You know that new year's resolution everyone has to eat healthier and spend less? Well Blue Fig can definitely help with that.  I met a few friends for brunch here and really enjoyed the experience. The great part was we all got delicious food and coffee without spending much.

I ordered the Roma sandwich and it was perfect.  My friends ordered an eggplant sandwich, waffle with fruits and yogurt, and a breakfast sandwich.  All of which were just the right balance of savory and healthy.  Not too rich that the bread was soaked with flavoring, but also not sparse that it lacked flavor. 

Really liked the back patio ambiance as well.  It was not busy when we went, so it was a cozy atmosphere amidst the Mission hustle. 

Another gem to add to SF favorite brunch spots!
author: Lea F.

description: Friendly place in the Mission for a solid breakfast and coffee in a sweet setting.
author: Sheri G.

description: Comfortable little cafe with good coffee and nice food.  Egg sandwich with basil aioli was slightly too salty (but OK with my date) - Irish oatmeal was great.
author: Jaina S.

description:
We loved it here. The staff is super friendly, especially the witty cashier. The food was very fresh and absolutely delicious! They have free wifi and don't mind if you plug in, log on and hang out.

I will definitely be back!
author: Alexia M.

description: Surprisingly good little coffee and food spot. A well oiled machine that's more than meets the eye, and better quality than I expected for the price point. Time passes quickly here, inside or outside. I wish they took card and I wish they were open later, but I'm grateful for the lovely space, service and yumminess, period. I've been a little lost since Cafe Petra closed, but finding this café has given me direction again. It's a perfect place to read, write or catch up with a friend.
author: Jae R.

description:
For the price of a Roma egg sandwich I expected something more than just egg, cheese, tomato and lettuce on foccacia. The lack of any seasoning lead me to ask olive oil from behind the counter. The sandwhich needed some salt too, so I sprinkled some on, then it tasted better. I liked the Roma breakfast a lot after those touches. 

The asking price was around $7.50 I believe. Not really a bargain, and the portion wasn't that big either. Felt like a mere appetizer rather than a breakfast meal. 

Besides that the ambience was relaxed, and the counter help was having a good time when I swung by here. There are some cool photos and pieces of art up on the wall that are nice eye candy. 

If I come here again, I may just go with coffee.
author: Maximilian R.

description: Good cafe to go read a book or chat with friends...Inside, back patio or the parklet in the front.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
How did this place get 4.5 stars? What am I missing? I was surprised by the casualness - I imagined a much trendier or more upscale place.
