My breakfast sandwich was good - but mainly cuz of the aioli. The place is called "blue fig" - but is there any fig on the menu? The coffee was so-so. The atmosphere was OK - crowded, but unrushed and not too loud.

PS: Someone from the restaurant wrote me a super weird and confrontational note in reference to my review. Minus one star for awkwardness.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Oh Blue Fig, I have such a love/hate relationship with you.  On the one hand, you are always the perfect place to hang out and get some work done, never dead, but never as ridiculously crowded as a certain other trendy coffee shop down the road.  The ambiance is always nice and welcoming, and you have some delicious snacks to keep my belly full; the egg sandwich is to die for. 

 But on the other hand, Blue Fig, I always want myself finding more.  The wait for food and drinks can err on the lengthy side, and when it gets there, more often than not it is just kinda...meh.  And I have sampled a wide variety. Also, while I have quit drinking coffee I have had friends tell me that theirs is noticeably worse than at other places.

So in sum, Blue Fig is overall, not a bad place if you are in the area, but with so much that the neighborhood has to offer I would't put it as one of my favorites.
author: Mirae B.

description: I've been here twice and both times have been pretty good. The first time I had the blue waffle, which was delicious and enough for brunch. I like how you're able to sit either indoors, outside in front of the restaurant, or behind the restaurant. The second time I visited The Blue Fig, I had the Croque Madame. Yum... I love how good this is! I wish there was more to it, but it was enough to fill my hunger. If you haven't been to the Blue Fig before, then I suggest you to give it a try. There are also power outlets here, so it makes a great place to study.
author: Edgar G.

description:
This review is going to be lengthy and detailed. 

Sunday morning, 9/2, my friend suggested to try this nice looking coffee/light brunch spot in mission. It sounded like the right thing to do.

We got there around 12, the place looked packed with a few tables available here and there. There is sidewalk seating, main area seating and back patio seating which looked nice. My friend sat down at one of the tables and I walked to the counter to place our order. I asked for two coffees and mentioned they were going to be "for here". The 20something looking guy took two "paper cups" and walked to coffee machine. Right when he was about to pour the coffee, he turned around and explained "we have no more "for here" cups available". Well, perhaps they were out of the clean ones at the moment. Kinda ruins the Sunday brunch experience but no big deal.

Then I ordered some food, got a plastic number attached to a stand and walked to our table holding the paper cup coffees. After maybe 2 minutes of having seated myself, two other ladies walked in to the patio, holding "real" cups looking to see if there was any available spot. Still holding the no big deal attitude, I convinced myself they had just got them out of the dish washer.

My friend and I had some catching up to do, so we almost didn't realize how half an hour passed. I just looked up and noticed that our food was not here yet. The same guy that took my orders was passing by, I called him out and inquired about the order. He merely looked at me, barely stopped and on his way back to the main area just said "we are super busy this morning". Oh well, an egg sandwich and a french toast definitely needs some preparation...

After about another 20 minutes, It just got frustrating. I called another one of their staff and explained it had been 50 minutes that we were been waiting for the food to come. She left and after a couple of minutes returned with a "your order for some reason has not gone through... Do you want me to put it through?!!!!"

At that moment we decided we didn't wanna ruin our Sunday in such a place. Went to the cashier, the same guy had the nerve to return my cash to me with a vague explanation "I am sorry, there was something wrong with the toilet, it all got confusing and so and so..."

Definitely not giving it another chance.
author: Tara H.

description:
The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because the bagel was good!

Lose two stars because the cashier gave me n my friend this weird vibe.. she was too sassy!
author: Negative N.

description:
Came here for coffee with a friend. I ordered the chai latte. Pretty good, I would have preferred if it were a little more potent but not bad overall. 

Cute patio seating area outside which is nice on a sunny day. Looks like a popular spot to do work on a laptop.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
This is my favorite cafe in the area. Good ambiance, outdoor patio and front parklet, and the service is always really friendly and warm. It's comfortable to sit and work here, and the coffee is good, and more affordable than at many of the cafes in the neighborhood. 

If you're looking for an amazing meal, I don't know if this is the spot; I haven't eaten much of the food here, and don't feel strongly inclined to. This is more of a chill neighborhood coffee shop that happens to have some food than a restaurant. So long as your expectations are right, Blue Fig is top notch, and a great place to spend the afternoon working and sipping.
author: Sam Z.

description: Looking to try a new place, I came upon the blue fig. A small quaint cafe with lots of character. Nice works of art line the walls and a wonderful selection of baked goods at the counter. I decided to try the croque Madame. A ham sandwich with a fried egg and bechamel sauce. It was really good! Very light and refreshing for a ham sandwich! The Lattes are fun in that they put a little drawing of different types on the top of your latte. Very artsy! The waffle is pretty good too. It has a whole grain taste to it. Light and crisp and topped with sliced strawberries and bananas. The blue Fig is a nice spot to hang out and chat as well as a great place to get quality food. If your ever on Valencia st in the mission give them a try!
author: Roger P.

description: The food at Blue Fig, like the egg sandwiches are amazing. Quality of the drinks are also good. But I had to give it 3 stars for their service. The pickup time they state is never right. They usually start making your food once you show up. I think for a place with this many customers going in and out, they just don't have capacity. Their pastries are almost entirely gone before 10, and the kitchen is too small to meet the demand of that many people. I also don't see why they've continued to be cash only.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Not the quickest spot, but well worth it. TRY THE EGG SANDWICH! By far the best egg sandwich I've had! Great outdoor seating early in the day. Iced latte is also good!
author: Cam J.

description:
This place is off the chain. Let me tell you why:

1. Coffee cake. They cut it into portions meant for Andre the Giant and it's frickin' delicious. LOTS of crumblies on top. If you don't know what I mean by crumblies, you don't know what good coffee cake is.

2. The egg sandwich. I think you can make this vegetarian, but they serve it with Boar's Head ham and this really delicious, light basil aioli. It tastes like bechamel sauce and marries perfectly with the expertly fried egg inside a double canopy of focaccia heaven.

3. The "blue" waffle. This waffle is special in that it's made from blue cornmeal, but still eats like the waffle you've always loved. It's hearty and crispy, and they serve it with this amazing fig reduction sauce and maple syrup. 

This is one of those cafes that look like they could be great or terrible. But once you've tried the fare, you know what's good. Also, they have wifi and an adorable backyard with lots of seating available. I could easily spend hours here. Also, the prices are totally on point, if not cheap, considering the great food they offer!
author: Rachel F.

description:
Really enjoy the serene atmosphere here. Usually quiet and nice place to get some work done.

Food is great. When they're not busy, staff is fast and attentive. The breakfast sandwiches on focaccia is delicious. Nothing microwaved, all fresh ingredients, and the perfect seasoning on everything.
author: Vitaliy L.

description:
Just when I thought there wasn't room for another cafe in the Mission, I was proven wrong by The Blue Fig.  I've been *unable* to wake up the requisite 10 minutes in order to stop by for more than a cuppa coffee on my way to work early mornings, but said I'd be back for their self-proclaimed awesome chai.  

Yesterday I fulfilled my promise, and they fulfilled theirs.  

Though I guess it depends on what kind of chai you like.  Having been once to India, I like the Indian chai---tea and many spices simmered in milk for a long while, sweetened with honey.  This means spicy chai.  Milky chai.  Yum.  This stuff didn't come from a powder/carton.  

I also tried the special brunch of the day, bacon waffles with scrambled eggs.  I did an injustice to the food by getting it to go, and look forward to having more time to sit and eat there, and try the croque provencal or blue corn waffle.  I suspect there is a nice little patio out back.....
author: Aimee B.

description:
Stopped in here because I was starving, the menu posted on the window looked tasty and there were several open tables to work on my laptop. Very friendly vibes and a lot of the patrons seemed to be regulars, which I always appreciate. The barista asked how my day was and seemed like he actually meant it. 

I ordered the croque provencal after debating between the waffle and I was very happy with my choice. Didn't get any coffee, but will definitely try some next time I visit. All around a solid place to eat and get some work done!
author: Kelsey G.

description:
Slow and confused service compounded with small portions make me go elsewhere next time.

Location/atmosphere - good
Cozy, good noise level, and has both inside and outside seating area.

Food - ok
The quality of the food and coffee is good enough, but the portion is too small.  I ordered a croque madame and we went straight into another restaurant afterwards for more food :p

Price - ok
$8 for the croque madame and $2 for coffee.  Neither cheap nor expensive.

Service - poor
This kills it.  We waited 40 minutes for our food.  Look, I understand that you get busy from time to time and you have a small kitchen.  At the very least though I think it's better if you warn the customer that you are a bit backed up.  We would have ordered a little pastry to share while we wait.  In this case they ended up with less income and disgruntled customer.
To make matter worse, they put the wrong order in for my wife (they gave her the bruschetta salad instead of the breakfast bruschetta.  Great .. 40 minutes wait for something she didn't want.

Overall, this place was a disappointment.  The Mission, and especially Valencia, is blessed with so many good cafes, restaurants and bars there really is no reason for me to go back here.
author: Andi H.

description:
I came here to eat but the guy behind the counter was coughing, smoking outside, rubbing his armpits and wiping his nose. Which is fine if you wash your 
hands...only, he did not. Don't get me wrong, the guy was nice, but he was also sick! Perhaps I'll return after flu/cold season... come to think of it, perhaps not. I ended up ordering a Pellegrino soda instead :-/
author: Melissa B.

description: A great place to relax, eat well and read. The Coffee is good, the ble vaffle is good and The backyard is great.
author: Lisbeth H.

description:
the quality in food and overall cafe cleanliness has dropped by at least 50% in the past six months. most noticeable was the removal of the line cook--he was very talented and added a nice edge to the space. He also seems to have been the one who wiped the tables too.

I think the focus on putting in the seating areas has detracted from the basics for a cafe: good food and clean!
author: shanestar h.

description:
As a coffee shop wh*re, this is one of the few coffee shops in the mission I enjoy coming back to.

The trade off of finding a coffee-shop that isnt crammed; usually means you'll be given mediocre coffee (at best).  Alternatively you'll happily find a quiet place to sit and "work" but are served yuckiness.

I feel that the Blue Fig is able to offer me both a seat, pleasant place to work and also some AMAZEBALLS coffee.  

Nice outside area in the back, as well as a parklet in the front.  Great service too...

One last thing, I dont understand how some reviewers have said what a wonderful place this is, and then only review with 3 stars... I'm hoping the only reason for doing this, is to keep it one of SFs best kept secrets!!
author: Julie B.

description: Solid breakfast place. Don't miss the charming patio in the back. My favorite snack is the rugelach pastry.
author: Sarah M.

description:
The setting is just perfect, and as a visitor to the city who didn't really get what the mission was all about, the blue fig finally made me understand. They've created a lovely little outdoor seating area, and on a warm sunny day like today, the ambiance was just wonderful. 5 stars for the front and back patios. 

Unfortunately, we waited 45 min for this famous "blue waffle", which was just below underwhelming. When we asked for utensils, we were brought wet utensils. WET utensils. Service leaves something to be desired.
author: Sylvie C.

description:
I'm not a hipster, I swear. I can't stand the back patio. It reminds my of a backyard I used to have in Daly City. If you're claustrophobic then steer clear. 

The Pastrami sandwich was amaze balls and the barista is the most talented Latte foam artist I've ever met. He made me the "Me Gusta Meme" in my latte. Me gusta, indeed. Pictures coming soon. Check out my Foodspotting account if you can't wait.
author: Tiffany L.

description: First time at The Blue Fig, their service was very nice and fast! There was no wait, and it was so delicious I ordered the Blue Waffle, it was sour yet the maple syrup balances it out. So satisfied. What I ordered to drink was the Masala Chai, I love chai's so much so I had to try it out. It was spice, and it came in a cute small glass mug. I will definitely be back again soon.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
A friend and I went to Blue Fig on a Sunday (labor day wknd) around 11am, and the service had more to be desired. The coffee (had a simple Americano) was good and hot. We ordered the Blue Corn Waffle and Breakfast Bruschetta. We waited about 40min before asking about our food, since most of the tables in the back patio had turned over. I think our orders got lost. It took about another 10min for my waffle, and about another 10min for the Breakfast Bruschetta. So about an hour total for both of us. 

The food was fine, nothing too extravagant; and a bit cold, so it might have been sitting for a while.

Overall the space is small on the inside, but the outdoor front seating is nice, and the back patio is nice (where we were). I give credit to the 3 people working the restaurant (one had to do the register + make coffee; the other the food), they were very busy, and they were doing their best to get the food out. 

I think the place was under-staffed which created a bad experience for us, and probably wasn't a good work environment for the people working. Other people around us who had been waiting had been asking about their food (one couple got a refund and left).

When we were leaving, the bathroom was flooding too, so water was spilling out and noone could use the bathroom. Rough times for Blue Fig that day, maybe we just caught 'em on an off-day. I don't think I would go back, cause there are other brunch places to check out around the area.
author: Kalpesh J.

description: Very good coffee, in large quantities if you desire. They only take cash though! And basically have no gluten free food, so, you know, that isn't cool. But good coffee!!
author: Shelby S.

description:
A wise person (probably) once said that your establishment must excel in 6 categories to receive 5-stars.  Let's dissect why Blue Fig fits this description.  

1) Good tea selection
2) Delicious Organic Irish Cut Oats
3) Back patio outdoor seating
4) Fast wi-fi
5) Plenty of outlets
6) Cute barista lady

Kudos Blue Fig.
author: Zach D.

description: Blue corn waffle was okay (not too fond of the maple syrup) & the chai tea latte was good. Cash only!
author: Emily C.

description: Maybe it was an off day, but the place seemed dirty, under-staffed and the service was terrible (hence under-staffed). The food was okay but I would expect more for the price.
author: Ruben B.

description: Ordered a hot chocolate and a Sausalito turkey. The chap behind the bar was quite disinterested in his job, and after getting past the howling sounds coming from the steaming of milk (big no no if you make any kind of hot coffee drink) and the absolutely tasteless hot chocolate, I decided I had just wasted 5 bucks. There's better options around.
author: Parth B.

description:
Love this place!  The room is lovely with local artists on the walls.  The folks are friendly and best of all, THEY MAKE GREAT FOOD!

Yesterday I had the Croque Madam, a soft creamy egg on brioche toast, with a wonderful bechemel sauce.  Today it was Irish Oats, so warm and creamy and healthy.  

The coffee is great, strong and dark.   

I'll have to come back for lunch and try a salad.
author: Unemployed D.

description:
I told the gal working here I was going to give it one star so no one else would know about it.  But I just can't .... I fell in love with the croque madame.  I love it more than life itself.

Also, love it when I can get my favorite blend of green tea served in a funky tea contraption.
author: Justin R.

description: Food is great. Service sucks. They let you stand at the front while they chat with each other and it's up to you to speak up for service.  Being the only person in line at the register is not enough of a trigger to warrant help. Prepare for the annoyed tone when you ask for service.
author: John F.

description:
Blue waffles anyone???

I stumbled into Blue Fig the other morning. And while there are a ton of eateries in the Mission District, there are few that are open quite this early.

Something of a cross between a coffee shop and a cafeteria, it seems the atmosphere would make better for late night coffee and a chat rather than solely as a foodie destination.

The afore mentioned blue waffles gets its name from the hearty blue cornmeal used to make 'em. The fig reduction had almost a balsamic tartness to it, which you can offset as much as you like with the provided syrup.

Would I come back for a bite? I'm not sure that I would. The competition for your appetite in this neighborhood is just too fierce.
author: Tony L.

description: Great little spot. Good sandwich menu and friendly staff. Outside seating is a plus. Good tunes as well.
author: Luke E.

description:
I wanted to love this place, but the service was really poor. We went on a Sunday for lunch, ordered two sandwiches (eggplant and Reuben), and were told they were out of all bread except baguettes. That's cool, no big deal. Then they're cash only which is always annoying. We wait a while, then our sandwiches arrive. To our surprise, we received one Reuben and one EGG sandwhich. We explained to the girl that this was not what we had ordered. Her reply- oh, do you want me to make the EGGPLANT sandwich?  I had to laugh a little because the two were totally different sandwiches... of course I'd like the one we ordered! She leaves to make the right order, 20 minutes go by, and when she returns with the eggplant sandwich she hands us the cost of the egg sandwich. I thought, wow, they don't need to give us our money back for the mistake... But then she says the egg sandwich was a few bucks cheaper so we'll need you to come in and pay the difference. This was pretty shocking to me. I've worked in restaurants my entire life and would never charge a customer for the cafe's mistake! Especially over $3! Needless to say we won't be back. 

Stars are for good enough food and outdoor seating.
author: Rachel B.

description:
We went for lunch Saturday mid-afternoon. They had several open tables, which filled up after we sat down.

Roma Breakfast Sandwich - a favorite (after the SUPER blue corn waffles w/ banana/blueberries and fig reduction - previous trip). (A whole) Roma tomato sliced, with a fried egg, mozzarella, ham and basil leaves on a great panini bun.  

P.S. Be sure to ask for the Roma "Breakfast" sandwich or you won't get the egg and ham, just the other ingredients.
author: Stephen M.

description: Limited menu but does things well. Food is tasty, staff is professional. Outdoor seating. Good breakfast on the run option but not fast food (and not super fast) but worth the little wait.
author: Peg W.

description:
The Best Waffle In SF~!!!!
I love the blue waffle, texture, flavor, portion, everything is so perfect!!

Always coming back for blue waffle
author: JustinE Y.

description: The cashier/waiters are very sweet and friendly. The food comes out fairly quick and the dishes are simple but tasty. Sit on the sidewalk and people watch or enjoy the back patio!
author: Courtney H.

description: Croque Madame / Croque Provencal are so yummy. They also make kick-ass cappuccino. The place is cash only, but there is an ATM inside. There's also small backyard, unfortunately sun there is limited.
author: Ana K.

description: Me and my boyfriend went here for breakfast because of the ratings on yelp. The service was pretty lousy. The vibe when we arrived felt very rushed as far as taking orders but when we sat down and waited for my irish oats and his blue waffle, it 25 minutes to receive and we weren't given silverware. My boyfriend had to ask the waiter twice for a fork and knife which he was displeased to get. We wouldn't have asked if they had available clean silverware at the condiments area. This is just our experience for 6/21/2014 but the other patrons seemed a little peeved as well.
author: Oluyemi O.

description:
I always go to Mission Creek, so this was my first time visiting.  The Blue Fig has a much nicer barista then the weirdos at Misson Creek, and a really tasty vegetarian sandwich.  The music is actually good coffeeshop music, set at the appropriate level which drowned out the noisy old windbag who wouldn't shut up about her 'feelings'.  Some people are just so touchy, you know?

One of my biggest pet peeves is round tables at coffeeshops that I want to work on with my laptop.  My laptop IS A RECTANGLE, PEOPLE.   I understand that some people think of coffeeshops as places to eat and drink coffee and that round tables encourage conversation, but screw that.  I want a square table.  So even though the music is awesome, the service is nice and there is a lot a beautiful natural light, I really freaking want a laptop shaped table.
author: Dana M.

description:
The Blue Fig is a lovely low key place to grab some really good food and coffee.  I'm in love with their croque madame, it's just the perfect amount of food and seriously delish. The lattes are great, and they always have such fun foam art, which is unnecessary but does brighten my day.

They're working on a patio out back, and I can hardly wait for it to be finished.

Everyone who works there is really nice, and the prices are definitely reasonable. Come here if you want a great tasting breakfast, and a nice relaxing atmosphere.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Mixed.

The savory waffle was really good. It came with a salad and mushroom tapenade, and it just worked.

My bagel with Swedish salmon was okay (granted, I made an uninspired choice). I did not find it any better than Noah's. The hot chocolate was watery with no richness. It could not be explained as Mexican-style as it did not have subtle flavors. 

We waited for 30 minutes from the time we ordered at the counter until our food arrived. The server checked on us at 20 minutes (good), and apologized when she brought the food (also good). It is a very small kitchen and a lot of tables (inside, out front on the sidewalk, and a patio in the back); no one was getting their food quickly. Perhaps it was a holiday crew that did not have experience; perhaps the Labor Day crowd just overwhelmed it.
author: Richard H.

description:
I'm a big fan of The Blue Fig.  It's super low key, the food is delicious and very moderately priced.  I got the Roma egg sandwich special and it was soooo delicious.  

There are a few tables in front of The Blue Fig and it's the perfect place to catch some Mission sun, while people watching and enjoying a delicious breakfast or brunch. I can't wait to come back here for a super chill and yummy breakfast.
author: Tina T.

description: Had a pretty good brunch here but wasn't blown away. I would definitely recommend it, and go back for more. The back patio was a real selling point and provided a really nice place to enjoy our food.
author: Allison B.

description:
I had the egg sandwich - pretty good for a simple little sandwich. Coffee was extra strong.

Good for the simple "let's grab coffee" date.
author: Jennifer S.

description: The food is good, and so are the drinks, but the girls working here have major attitude and are not friendly. If I want to go to a coffee shop and relax it's not going to be here because of that alone.
author: Dasha W.

description: Really nice, calm and social vibe. Close to Missions madness it's good refuge. Americano is pretty nice. Love the backside patio with nice live plants.
author: Shahey R.

description: This review is for the coffee only which is on par with a gas station. My husband bought a cappuccino which ended up being espresso with a bunch of foam thrown on top. The only redemption was a glorious patio.
author: Alyssa E.

description:
I ordered the Greek yogurt with honey, granola and fresh fruit. Looking forward to the fresh fruit I was bummed. I sit down to eat my yogurt and there's granola, and dried cranberries & raisins....fresh fruit=cut up banana. I should have bought a Chobani and called it a day. The staff also work slow. The lady preparing my yogurt was so amused by the little boy in line behind me that pouring the granola, and dried (not fresh) fruit on my yogurt was a 10 minute ordeal. The little boy wasn't doing anything anything amusing other than saying he wanted a cookie.  Awwwwwwwwww 

As far as the latte I ordered...that was good. Nothing great but I would have it again. Just wouldn't go out of my way for this place. 

Bottom line...nothing tasted horrible but don't expect what you read on the menu to be in your hand or on plate. And for the owner : fresh fruits does not include dried fruit and a banana.
author: monica n.

description: The the visit was as efficient as one guy taking orders, preparing the food and the coffee could make it. The food was pretty good and the drip coffee was ok.
author: Mary R.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH I've ever had- tasty focaccia, and some kind of seasoning on the egg.  Incredible with the basil aioli.  On a ciabatta roll.  So so so so so so so so good.  I will dream about this sandwich for years to come.

We also got the breakfast bruschetta, which was not that great and mostly confusing: three slices of decent bread, one with almond butter and honey (yum), one with basil cream cheese (quite refreshing), one with peanut butter and bananas.  Not that filling and overpriced.

Beautiful space.  I'd same come here just for that egg sandwich, cooked right before you in the open kitchen.
author: Yen D.

description: Great place for a quick bite for breakfast. I got an egg sandwich which was delicious. More importantly, there were some AMAZING chocolate chip cookies for sale that they bake in house using a dough company. Small inside so not good for large groups.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Really friendly staff, beautiful backyard garden and a nice parklet out front, good coffee, reliable wifi, space to work, and delicious made-to-order food.

If you go during busy hours, you might be in line for a while, or have your order forgotten now or then, but it's worth the occasional mishap. Every bit the friendly neighborhood coffee shop that one wants to have around the corner.
author: Chris M.

description:
For starters, not an actual brunch spot but there's still plenty about the Fig to keep you from the blues.

As mentioned, this is more a coffee shop with great food than an actual restaurant.  Their Egg Sandwich is a healthy dose of morning protein, being a nice morsel of eggs, cheese, ham and aioli on a bagel of your choice (wheat!).  Their Roma Egg sandwich is just as good but throw in some basil and tomato.  I realized based on the advice of others, not to mention viewing in person, I'll have to stick around for the waffle as it looks like a great bit of breakfast deliciousness.

Food aside, the Fig seems to be a good coffee shop.  It's small so if you have the odd pair screeching over conversation or laughing loud you don't have much respite but in my experience it's never crowded and it seems like a great place to get some work done.

If my usual speed dealer (Ritual Roasters) wasn't so close, I'd probably end up here more often.
author: Steven R.

description:
Great little cafe.  I was in the city with my little brother who needed a rest.  He got a hot cocoa and a cookie, and seemed to enjoy both.  I didn't warn him the cookie was vegetarian (-:

I had a tea and it was very good.  They have a nice selection of loose-leaf tea and brew it in one of those bottom-sealed pots.  It worked well.  My partner had an espresso and said it was good.

The staff was friendly and their menu looked good.  I enjoyed the art and the overall ambiance - I'd say it is everything you would want in a cafe in the Mission.
author: Nicole A.

description:
I stopped in to get an iced tea - they had one kind, one size. I handed the guy a $20, and realized later that I'd gotten change for a ten. For $2.95 (1.95 + $1 tip) the tea was kinda okay, but $12.95, not so much. In any other circumstances I would have gone back, but I was carrying a 20+ lb dress and didn't realize his error until I got out my change many blocks later to figure out whether I wanted to get a cab or get lunch. 
On the bright side, walking 2 miles with a 20lb dress and no lunch made the rest of my day seem a lot better.

::edit::
Employee saw my post and apologized, offering me my $10 back. I live kinda far away (aaand don't log into Yelp often enough...) so I didn't take him up on it, but I had to un-one-star my review about it, 'cause it's the thought that counts.
author: Christy S.

description:
Blue Fig makes my early morning walk to work so much better.  The staff is SUPER friendly and nice to talk to, they have a GREAT tea selection (I am off coffee) and the Cinnamon buns make me a happy camper.  

I am kinda shocked how a cafe less then half a block from the Hipster Hell that is Ritual Coffee can be so nice and laid back but I am SO glad.  They will have my biz for a long while!

PLUS! BAGELS!!! AWESOME!

I will just say I wish they opened a little earlier as I have to be at work most days before 7 AM.  While they say they open at 7 AM there are somedays where it seems liked it is more 7:15 etc.
author: Amy P.

description: Cute little spot to have coffee and get some work done. I ordered the special baked tofu sandwich on the barista's recommendation and it is delicious!
author: Erica D.

description:
+ Incredibly friendly staff - always smiling, unusually helpful, genuinely care
+ Clean, open, sunny atmosphere
+ Sturdy marble-topped tables, great for working alone but with plenty of room to share
+ Water is easy to access and constantly refilled
+ Cute quotes in bathroom ('As for butter or margarine, I trust cows more than scientists')
+ Clientele is pleasant, unpretentious, grateful, and generally friendly.

I meet up with a friend every week to try to get our lives in order. Blue Fig gets us in the right frame of mind and it's a pleasure to spend time there.
author: Megan G.

description: Very strong house coffee. Delicious breakfast!! Good quality food and attention to detail.
author: Jessa L.

description: Came here on an especially sunny day. ordered the croquet madame and an ice coffee. the patio shaded by the surrounding buildings was a perfect refuge.  the coffee was great,  the croquet was delicious. the service was what you'd expect from a cafe on Valencia: helpful but indifferent. but that's part of the ambience, no? would definitely come back.
author: Kayla L.

description:
5 stars for the white mocha - It made my morning so much brighter.  My favorite white mocha in the mission (so far). 
Cost: $3.85 for a 16oz.

3.5 stars for the blue waffle.  It was really good, don't get me wrong... but it wasn't spectacular. The fig reduction syrup is a glorious thing - the one thing that makes this waffle a smidge above average.  Though, I must say that it beats the crap outta the eggo that usually starts my morning.  So it was good, but next time I go, I'll probably try something different.  
Cost : $6.95.  

The guys working there were all really nice, and the dude taking my order took the time to ask how my morning was going.  My coffee came out in a few minutes, and my waffle came about 5 minutes after that.

Over  all, a 4.5 star cafe breakfast experience. Blue Fig, I shall return.
author: Ron C.

description:
The pictures on yelp really deceived me; the food looks much better on yelp than in person.  I think it's the square plates that throw you off.  

We ordered the croque madame and the blue waffle.  The waffle came and it looked soft and flabby even though it had a dark rich toasty brown colour.  We break into the waffle and as it looked, it was truly a soft bland waffle with no real texture.  The croque madame was also underwhelming and nothing special.  We left very unsatisfied.  

Also note, this is a cash only place.
author: Miss H.

description:
I have to say I was a bit disappointed.  Went for breakfast, and it definitely seems like the kind of place that would have awesome breakfast food.  I thought the waffles were a bit cold and didn't have a lot of flavor, and there weren't heaps of options.  The fig reduction was good though.

The coffee was great though, and the barrista was nice enough to make a custom espresso for us, which was delicious.
author: Cara M.

description: The Blue Fig is exceptional. It's an understated, happy place to enjoy awesome food and coffee. There's nothing better than breakfast served up with a smile and no pretention. I highly recommend the Blue Waffle.
author: Nick F.

description:
I like this place, but it has not satisfied my coffee exploration.

The lattes that I have gotten here have been a little inconsistent - but I am totally open to a place who will let someone learn to become a Barista - I just would rather not be part of the experiment.  

I really like that they are fast and have Monin coffee flavorings.
author: Autumn B.

description: They had me at the fancy design in my latte foam
author: Kelly S.

description: Went here to try to get a decent breakfast. Had a waffle which was good except for the dark sauce that tasted like vinaigrette. I don't know about you, but I don't like mixing sweet and sour flavors.
author: Melissa C.

description: really fantastic. delicious food, perfect espresso, kind people, great service, simple menu of healthy options.  Perfect empanadas - always a treat.
author: Sofia S.

description:
I love the Blue Fig and goes there every chance I get. They offer a small breakfast menu including my long time favorite lox bagel. It is served with preserved lemon, red onions and the salmon is cured in house. All this for $6.50, I call it pure perfection. The ham & cheese sandwich on Focaccia is close my #2.

Good selection of tea, free wifi and you can always find a seat. What else to ask? I can't believe that they haven't increased their prices being in the epicenter of Valencia Hipster Corridor and I cross my fingers that it wont happen.

The only thing that troubles me is the tasteless selection of art on the wall and the interior esthetic in general. These grey walls are so boring... I sometimes day-dream drinking my Genmai Cha that some great architect will help them pimp it up....
author: Isabelle G.

description:
The folks who work here have been very nice whenever I've stopped in. I think this would be a 3 star review if it wasn't for that fact. 

On the downside, I so wish they accepted credit cards because I so hate carrying cash, and I would probably visit more if they changed that. But they seem to get a good amount of business (lots of folks chatting with friends or working on laptops), so maybe it's me that needs to change?

Anyway, I like the greens and the fig vinaigrette that they serve with their sandwiches. It balances out the heaviness of bread and cheese and stuff. Also, if you get cucumbers on a bagel, they cut it into superthin ribbons which probably sounds like no big deal, but I really like the texture of it. It feels fancy. haha. You should try it!
author: Cec C.

description: I've been meaning to write this review for a few years. I had such a positive experience with a barista at The Blue Fig that I wrote an article (http://tinyurl.com/lyk688w) about it. The short version - my car broke down on Valencia right in front of the Blue Fig early one Friday evening. I think business was slow in the cafe because the barista noticed what was happening and came out to offer me a latte or a chai while I waited for Triple A. And when he brought me my tea and I tried to pay him, he wouldn't take any cash. I've visited the Blue Fig several times since, and I've thanked him in person, but it feels good to finally share my appreciation publicly. The Blue Fig is a solid neighborhood cafe, and I'll always have a soft spot for the place.
author: Lea S.

description:
The blue corn waffle had me feeling sappy happy. I'm sure the fig reduction syrup helped that emotion along. It's a lure for me to know a meal goes from ground to flour pound without too many interludes, interjections, and intermissions. By no means is this waffle Belgian, it's closer to eggo than ego promoting as it's a compact car like a waffle that rides with chicken. Certainly no waste in taste here as they squeeze in that flavor. 

Croissant and orange juice are well buttered and pressed, respectively.
author: Ber P.

description:
Pleasant, if modest, atmosphere and helpful staff, but an overdiluted from-concentrate masala chai that left me disappointed.

I'll favor one of the other cafés in the neighborhood next time.
author: Mark R.

description: I've frequented this place often and the food is inconsistent. One day it's homemade granola with yogurt and berries, the next its crappy Kellogg's type granola with bananas.
author: nana b.

description: The egg sandwich was off the chain!  The perfect amount of butter and toasted bread to compliment fluffy eggs, cheese and ham.  French toast was dressed up with nuts, bananas, chocolate and whipped cream.  All in all a great place to eat.  Iced coffee was very good too.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
Sorely needed high caliber cafe on Valencia.  The absolute dearth of decent cafes along this strip until now is frankly staggering, given the neighborhood demographic.  
Now there is somewhere to go with good coffee, awesome cafe fare (love the egg sandwich for breakfast or the turkey sandwich) and delightfully lacking in pretension.
So, if you're looking for somewhere pleasant to sit, with appealing menu items to accomany your caffeinated beverage and whatever you're working on, Blue Fig is definitely your best bet.
author: Jane F.

description:
I needed 2 things...  a good sandwich and a good latte.
This place worked out very well.. 
I had the Vegetarian Sandwich--Roasted Portobello Mushroom, fresh water mozzarella, roasted bell peppers, tomato tapenade on ciabatta.
Followed with a latte, which was made to perfection.
I'll be coming back...  maybe next time for Sunday brunch.
Oh, the guy and girl who worked there-- possibly the owner/s..  very friendly.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Cute little cafe that the FI and I tried for breakfast. We were actually going somewhere else but didn't want to wait in a long line, so we found this place.  The breakfast sandwiches were yummy, I did not try the waffle but want to go back so I can.  
Not somewhere I would drive out of my way to go, but if you're in the area it's worth stopping by.
author: Monica P.

description: Coffee. Smallish, needs some ambiance. But great breakfast menu. The oatmeal I had was seriously good.
author: Will D.

description:
The best breakfast sandwich I've had. 
I got the "egg sandwich" which normally has ham, egg, sharp white cheddar, and basil aioli- but I got it without the ham. It was DEVINE ohmygoodness so good I was talking about it for hours afterwards. I think it's the white cheddar that makes it. 
Minus one star for pretty slow service, and the dish my boyfriend got really wasn't that great (the blue waffle-I don't really get what all the fuss is about for that). 
100% sure I'll go back for that sandwich in the near future. Maybe tomorrow..
author: Hillary L.

description: Drowsy barista that didn't know the menu. PAINFULLY slow to get our food, even though all we got were bagels and there were no other food orders. When we finally got our food, it was pretty disappointing fare. Safeway deli would be better food. Won't be going back to Blue Fig again.
author: John Q.

description:
Cute little place with really friendly staff.  I was here at 10:30am, but one friend was running late so I ended up walking around the mission for an hour to kill some time.  Came back at 11:30am and the place had a line.  We found a spot outside and had our late brunch and people watched.  I had the blue corn waffle and a coffee -- the perfect pair, yum.  

*Note - It's cash only
author: Sally Q.

description:
Glad I waited to yelp again after my disappointing second visit, a two star cornmeal waffle that was high on price and low on bananas. It's their signature Blue Waffle, and you should pass.

But as I discovered on visit three, sandwiches are much more to my liking. Their house tapenade is very good, and works brilliantly with the turkey on a wheat roll. Greens come on the side.

So rather than have my last yelp be an unfortunate two stars, glad I can go with three. My first visit for a parfait and an americano (below) is still my four star favorite.
author: Jason B.

description:
AWESOME. EVERYTHING AWESOME, I say! I am a picky betch about sandwiches but I have so much respect for The Blue Fig. My friend is French and she says the Bechamel sauce on the Croque Madame/Provencal kicks ass. I don't even care if  she didn't think that b/c I love it so much, I'd fight her in a duel over it. But alas I love her and she does agree that it's awesome. Understand that it's the tits and you should go tomorrow to try it!!  People of Yelp, these sandwiches are worth the money and are well layered/designed. 

I've ALWAYS had a crazy pleasant experience here. Talk to Rami (main chef;) he is the best! I don't know about the other reviews concerning it being hipstery (what the balls?) or its decor. I bring great, new people with me always and everyone LOVES it! The staff is so rad that I don't even look at the decor, which is basic and simple anyway. Focus on your convo and meal man- or- give some suggestions and help decorate? I don't know. What I do know is that I love the staff and also the food! Especially the Croque Madame, Croque Provencal (with homemade Fig Dressing Salad..SHIT Yeah!,) and the Turkey Sandwich. I need to try more but I keep ordering that damn Croque Madame b/c it's too, too good! You bastards! (in a good way :) Keep it up buddies! Much, much love always!!! 

-Y
author: Yvannia P.

description: The Blue Fig is a fantastic little brunch spot: it's a cross between a cafe and a sit down joint, with a simple, straight forward, delicious menu. Most smaller places offer the same mundane pastries and breakfast items, but everything at the BF is fresh, amazingly good, and served up with delicacy. The folks there are have a great attitude, as the know that what they're offering is amazing. The egg sandwich w a little green salad calls to me in my dreams. Great work!
author: John C.

description: Great neighborhood cafe close to Delores Park! Had the Blue Waffle and the fig reduction syrup was delicious.. Sit in the backyard where the atmosphere is warming and brings you to an SF state of mind!
author: Teddy S.

description: Cute little cafe in the Mission. They completely forgot my cappuccino for quite a bit of time, but were quick about it and super apologetic once reminded. Nothing too special about the cappuccino, but I liked the place so I may be back to try the food at some point.
author: Rowena L.

description:
PERFECT study place.
1. There are a billion outlets here.
2. Free wifi.
3. Reasonably priced.
4. Surrounded by cute other restaurants, shops, and cafes.
author: Juliana S.

description:
Solid cafe with good breakfast options. The steel-cut oatmeal with banana and brown sugar is disarmingly good! 

Not a fancy brunch destination/experience like Tartine, more of a neighborhood cafe spot.
author: Mandy H.

description:
This is a lovely and cozy little cafe on Valencia and 21st. The brew is always good, and their breakfast sandwiches quite hearty- made with TLC by the guy on the single pan stove behind the barista. I'm a fan of the ham and egg sandwich - almost big enough for two meal!

It's always a plus to have truly sweet employees that asks how your day is going and greets you as you leave.

Keep it up guys!
author: Jackie G.

description: This intimate little coffee shop was an excellent spot for Sunday brunch. Our group of four got there around 10:30 and had no problem finding a spot on the back patio. The lattes and coffee cake are absolutely delicious and perfect to enjoy while waiting for your food. We got egg sandwiches and Croque Madame and both did not disappoint! Will definitely be coming back the next time we are in the mission.
author: Katie L.

description: This place was cool and fun, and the girl up front was very nice to me. I had never been to SF before and was by myself waiting for a plane (I was in Napa and returning home). She told me all the cool places to go nearby and about the park close by, which was awesome. Also, they had awesome coffee.
author: Kayla W.

description: It was okay, nothing special. I ordered a chai which was good, but after having the yummiest one every in LA there's no real comparison. Service was average, they were friendly. I was bummed that I couldn't sit in the outside back area with my little dog..which i thought was weird because there were dogs inside the cafe. I probably would have enjoyed it a lot more if I could've been in the back..oh well
author: Coco C.

description:
it's very apparent through the many reviews, photos, and if you've taken your ass out to the blue fig, that the food IS amazing and IS of higher than average quality.

Menu was not super long, which i like, but still consisted of a variety of items.

Seating area was jam packed on the weekend, and i'm assuming this is a regular problem (for customers) every weekend. I saw an outside area in the back, but wasn't sure if they accommodated seating behind the house. A sign would be nice, or more tables and chairs. :)

Parking is a major biizzach. esp. on the weekend. after circling the mission area, asking a gajillion people if they were leaving, you will find parking. I will send you good vibes to hopefully shorten this process.

Food.. Croque Madame. Ham in between two french toast, topped with an over easy egg smothered in bachamel sauce. HELLO SATURDAY! so tasty. Each savory bite is so worth the scavenger hunt for a parking spot and a table with available chairs. 

Service Sucked. I was really surprise as the yelp reviews says otherwise. I wonder what was up?

Will definitely return for another fight and meal! Hopefully, service will have lighten up by the time I return.
author: Alex C.

description:
Good stuff and not so expensive. Grab your coffee that costs more than your meal at near by Rituals and get your breakfast here. The nice outdoor tables give you a place to people watch while you are enjoying.

I had the bagel with lox. The lox was good and fresh with all the necessary accouterments like capers, onions and tomato. The bagel wasn't great but lets be honest; no bagel outside of new york and new jersey is that great....or even good for that matter.
author: Alex S.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! I recommend it to absolutely EVERYONE!  The service was great! Very very nice people!  The coffee was very good! I went with a group and everyone was pleased! The coffee came in mason like jars with handles.  The food was great, the bagels are really good here!  My daughter got coffee cake, honestly the best coffee cake ever.  The place is very nice.  Lots of seating... Tables in the front outside, inside, and even outside seating in the back!   Great place, if your in the area stop by!  Cash only, but not a problem if you have an ATM card! (:
author: Annette D.

description: I did not like this place. I tried to order food around 4:00 and the kitchen was closed. Instead I got a latte and it tasted so bad I couldn't drink it. I found the workers to be rude. The only good thing is they do have wifi. They are also cash only. Just such a shame I spent $3 on gross coffee when places like Ritual, Blue Bottle, and Sightglass are in close proximity. Shame on me.
author: Emily T.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops in the mission.  Coffee is super strong!  Great way to start my morning.  Thank you Blue Fig!!
author: Art M.

description: A friend and I went to Blue Fig for lunch. I got a Garden Greens salad and my friend got the Vegetarian sandwich. I was pleased with the taste and ingredients of the salad...fresh lettuce, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, candied pecans, and a delicious fig dressing.  However, the lettuce to other stuff ratio was disappointing...too much lettuce, not enough other stuff. I tried my friend's veggie sandwich and it was incredible. Roasted peppers on crunchy ciabatta. I would definitely go back but I'd get a sandwich next time. If it's a nice day, the little garden area out back is a charming and relaxing place to eat.
author: Corinne G.

description:
Breakfast in San Fran on Sunday morning!

For a non brunch, non fancy breakfast this place was great. It's a coffee shop  that happens to serve food too. I had the breakfast special which was like a caprese breakfast sandwich. delicious. Others in my party had yogurt and the blue waffle. I loved the waffle...regretted that I didn't get it.
author: Sonja R.

description:
Ate today for Opening day. YUM YUM YUM, wait... did i say YUM yet?

I ordered the Blue Waffle not knowing what to expect... why is it blue? LOL It arrived and it wasn't any ordinary fluffy waffle.. IT WAS WAY BETTER! The waffle iron they use makes smaller waffle squares and it doesn't make your waffle in the cliche round or square shape. This waffle was not too crispy, not too fluffy; PERFECT. Served with whip cream, bananas, and syrup on the side. DELISH.

OK being the fatty that I am. I sat eating my waffle eying the menu. I HAD TO order the pasta salad. NO REGRETS. It was so flavorful I NOM NOM NOM'ed every bite even though I was full.

My readers will know that I'm not even close to a sandwich fan, but I tasted my cousin's Ruben. TO DIE FOR.

Def. going to do a return visit to check out each item on the menu.
author: J-nine I.

description:
Ended up with girlfriends for brunch there today after seeing the insanely long lines at Tartine.

We ordered the savory waffle, sweet waffle, greens salad, and croque monsieur.  

By far the best dish was the croque monsieur

Pleasant atmosphere, no wait (on a Sunday at 11 am, great!); decent cafe au lait (in big mugs)

Salad greens were too wet w/ dressing and waffles were just OK.  

Nice service, though, and not too hipster yet.
author: Karen C.

description:
This place has certainly not gotten it's stride going yet.

Recommendations:

1. Flow: The crazy mess behind the counter, lack of communication with the customers on who was going to deliver the food/drinks or if they should wait at the counter, the line infringing on people's tables. Think about the experience, did you mean to make it feel hectic? Did you want me to finally sit down going oh  man am I actually going to get my food or will someone else?

2a. Pay attention to your staff/efficiency. Does it really make sense to keep the tea up on top of the counter so that the barista needs to reach up uncomfortably every time someone wants some? It's great to have them on display, but time is money and customers aren't always going to wait in line. Keep the containers on the counter, and the tea within arms reach.

2b. Consider a # system. I felt bad for your staff twice as they searched for someone, gave the wrong table other people's food.

3. FOOD: Waffles (especially with bacon inside) are a killer idea but  you need to step it up. They are tough, firm and chewy. People want fluffy, flavorful and mouth watering. Consider getting a different style waffle maker, or really embrace the quality of these ones.

4. The coffee - my cappuccino wasn't top notch

Keep trying, I like the location, the outdoor seating and the croque monsieur is awesome.
Good luck, I'll maybe try back in a few months.
author: Patrick D.

description: Finally came here for the first time today after living nearby for 7 years! I had the quinoa salad which was really great but a tad pricey. The back porch was really relaxing and atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. Definitely keeping this on the list when I'm in the area. Staff was really fun and sweet.
author: Laura D.

description:
Great, great, cappuccino.  

I tried cappuccinos at Ritual and Atlas Cafe a couple time each, but they just didn't do it for me.  Blue Fig is cheaper than the other two, at $3.01 for a small, and way better.  Fluffy foam piled high on top with a strong, delicious espresso taste underneath.   

Good prices, free wireless internet, friendly workers, yummy cappuccino.  And at 3:40 on a Monday afternoon, it was pretty quiet/easy to get work done, especially compared to Ritual and Atlas.
author: Susan D.

description:
Supreme coffee, immediately noticeable on the first sip. Strong, smooth, and rich in flavor. Even when I pour my milk in the coffee, or order a latte, the coffee is still flavorful. 
Best coffee in the area.

Friendly staff, epic recipes, quality ingredients and no gimmicks makes this my new favorite joint for coffee and quality eats.
Yummy lentil soup guys!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Come here for a nice casual lunch.  The folks working there were friendly patient with the various folks wandering in and out asking about their recent opening.

The Croque Monsieur was delicious, with a freshly fried egg draped in sauce.  It hit the spot.
author: Jay M.

description: I had a great experience here this weekend. I took my twin angels in for lunch. The oatmeal is chewy and yummy. We also got a custom turkey and tomato sandwich. Greens were fresh. Service was the best. Atmosphere was great.
author: Alex M.

description: Great lil cafe with patio and yummy bites and plates. Always plays music I love and just a chill sweet spot. Not hipster or techie-yet, which i appreciate.
author: Margot G.

description: There are actually surprisingly few places that fall somewhere between a full sit-down restaurant and deli takeout joint in this neighborhood. I can see where Blue Fig is filling a gap here. They offer a much wider selection of food than an average coffee shop, so you could realistically meet someone for a casual, inexpensive, but tasty breakfast or lunch here. I think it's a good addition to the area and plan to return often, when I need something fast but more than just a bagel/muffin.
author: Julia G.

description: We ordered the waffles, they told us they didn't have us any and would make us pancakes, and then served us waffles. Confused, but the blue cornmeal waffles were some of the best I've had. Also get the egg sandwich on focaccia! -- The toasty bread and creamy aioli really bring it above and beyond.
author: Soysizzle t.

description: Fancy brunch food for cheap?  Yes, please.
author: Ling W.

description: Walked by here today and decided to stop by for lunch.  I would say the food was very mediocre and the cafe seems to benefit from being in a good walkable location.  The staff was friendly but the food came out slow.  They didn't seem to even have a kitchen as everything was toasted or microwaved.
author: Christian W.

description:
Ritual was too crowded so I checked this place out.  I think it will be my first stop from now on *before* Ritual.  Warm & cozy, good music, quiet but not too quiet, nice tea selection (& fun little tea-brewing apparatus) & friendly staff.  

I didn't have any food but what I saw looked super tasty!  Those bagels were callin' my name!
author: Ann Larie V.

description: Best egg sandwich I have ever had and great service! Would definitely recommend this place to a friend!
author: Daniel B.

description:
Hate to bust in on the perfect rating but Blue Fig has some tweaking to do before it's 5-star worthy. Ordering at the counter was clunky because the staff member was new to the computer system. Open kitchens are awesome but theirs looked like a hot mess with 4 people crammed behind a tiny prep table.  With the size of their menu and full service coffee bar, I don't see how they can run a smooth operation.

Now onto the good, because there are plenty. The iced chai was fantastic - not too sweet, not too spicy. The salmon bagel was pretty average but they added a nice touch with the preserved lemon rind. 3-way sample bruschetta was worth trying but I recommend getting all basil cream cheese. By far the winner over the peanut butter and almond butter. Croque Madame looked like a smash hit all around the cafe. 

All in all, solid addition to the new Valencia strip and I imagine it will do quite well once the kinks are worked out.
author: Susan L.

description:
I hate to write a bad review ... and to be honest I've had a coffee a couple of times here where it was just fine and quite friendly.

However my husband and I went in there one night a couple of weeks back, and our experience was so awful I just can't let it go because the person working was SO INCREDIBLY rude. We didn't realize the place was about to close so we ordered coffee and sat down. He was very unfriendly and rude when I asked for milk (such an inconvenience .. right!!!) , and then proceeded to clatter chairs about, apparently displeased that we sat down, until we eventually decided to leave - we mentioned he should just have told us that he was closing and it wouldn't have been a problem for us to go somewhere else - at which point he passed a very rude comment and was quite clear he couldn't care less that his customers were not happy. Worst service I've seen in a long time - I can spend my money elsewhere.
author: susan h.

description:
A very casual and cold setting; I don't know if it was the concrete flooring, the stark decor or the blah server behind the counter... but nothing struck me as wow.  I don't think anyone in my group of three received so much as a hello or a smile.  It was kind of wierd.

The food, despite all that, was good.  I enjoyed the croque madame.  The bread was crunchy and buttery.  My husband enjoyed the blue corn waffle.  Overall, it was an ok experience.
author: elizabeth c.

description:
This part of Valencia needs a Ritual alternative with a parklet, and Blue Fig, I wish you filled this role better. The potential is there, I'd just like to see a bit of life and inspiration in the menu, some service speeds that didn't compete with cobwebs and maybe some tasty coffee.

I love the staff, the backyard and the parklet is a huge plus, but the potential here is so far unfulfilled.
author: Emptor D.

description: Great food, cute and relaxing courtyard space but service so laid back it's practically non-existent. While that can be nice at times it can also be super annoying. Twice I've been and ordered something only to discover - 15 mins later - that they've forgotten the order and are starting from scratch!
author: S C.

description: Stopped in because from the street this little coffee joint looked promising.  We caught a glimpse of a small back patio and thought it would be a cute spot to have an afternoon coffee.  Big. Mistake.  Cappuccino was at least 9/10 foam.  The back patio was not cute or quaint.  It pretty much looked like the place where the big dumpster would usually go.  Maybe the folks there jacked in to their computers were too busy to notice the tubs of bussed dishes left to attract flies? Wake up, Neo!!! You deserve better!
author: Cate W.

description:
Overrated!! First time the workers were so busy being hipsters they totally ignored me!
I tried again, cappuccino was a milky mess. They brought me the wrong sandwich and made out it was my fault! Um, you have two sandwiches with the same name!!! Am I supposed to look over the whole menu to make sure of this? Then the new sandwich took about 20 minutes and was delivered with a scowl! 
LOST CUSTOM!!!
author: Onyx D.

description: The Blue Fig rocks for several reasons.  It's a cafe, not just another coffee shop.  Lots of interesting people become regulars.  The food is outstanding - just seems like they have been ingredients and prepare the food with more passion and interest than the other cafes in the hood.  The owner, Shirene, grew up in the business, (her parents own Muddy Waters) and it's clear that she knows what she is doing.  I'm a huge fan based on the following: 1) music is always playing, 2) coffee, mate, and food are all delicious, 3) staff is super sweet, 4) outdoor seating and indoor seating 5) has plugs available so I can work with laptop as needed.
author: Maggie M.

description: Loved the outdoor seating. It was a beautiful sunny morning... however like many other reviewers note... the food took forever Sunday morning AND we were there early. When it finally arrived my food was cold, and I had to send it back... the final result with this waffle was unimpressive, dry. $2 up charge for real maple syrup. Fruit fresh yum! Coffee was good. Friendly service, prob just way understaffed. They do have a nice patio outback and great tables out front with a little parklette, lots of egg dishes for those who aren't allergic like me... I'd like to see more vegan friendly dishes; so maybe avoid peak times or stick with coffee.
author: Coco J.

description:
This was my neighborhood cafe when I lived in SF and one of the reasons why I stayed in the city so long. What is there to say? 

Their food and drink are amazing! I was a regular for the Roma breakfast sandwich and a quadruple espresso! On more famished visits their Reuben really hit the spot. Excellent staff, really on top of things even when they're crammed on a busy morning.

Used to go in there for hours at a time, sipping tea and reading. It's truly a quiet and friendly retreat that I miss now that I no longer live in SF. 5 stars!
author: Jim Y.

description:
AWESOME SPOT! It's a really chill place with plenty of seating and a great view of the always interesting Valencia street. 

The service from the barista that helped me was top notch. I ordered a Chai Latte and it was made nice and spicy (how i like it) with a good layer of foam. 

Next, I ordered the Ruben (my personal fav!) and it seriously ranks in my top 2! the other i had to travel across the US to get. It was served on warm toasted bread with a side of salad that had a spectactubular vinegarette dressing that complimented the sandwich perfectly! One of the things i really enjoyed about the sandwich was the texture. Its really easy to make a soggy dripping ruben. But THIS sandwich had just the right amount of dressings as to not overwhelm the taste buds and allow the bread to stay warm and toasty the whole way through. A difficult thing to do..

I have to agree with the above statement about the pasta salad. I had it too and it was amazing!!! I too was full but polished it off because of its yummy goodness lol. 

It was nice to actually be able to see your food being prepared. The owner himself is right out in the open preparing the food which is nice to see. 

The place is warm and welcoming, the staff is nice and knowledgeable, its "any age" friendly, and most important the food is awesome!
author: Judson P.

description:
Finally, a place that isn't Ritual Roasters where I can get some great coffee and something good to eat other than stale mission mini's with 30 people camping for three hours staring at laptops.

The Blue Fig offers friendly service with clean tables and lots of great coffee and food to choose from for breakfast, lunch, or a nighttime snack.
author: Kevin D.

description: Stumbled upon this nice little cafe last week while in the Mission District on vacation with the hubby.  Was pleasantly surprised.  I got the blue waffle and hubby got the egg sandwich.  Both were delicious!  If ever in the area again would definitely come back for breakfast or lunch.  Only thing I wasn't so crazy about was that it was definitely chilly outside and when someone (who I am pretty sure was the owner) came in to work, she left the door standing wide open so the entire restaurant became absolutely frigid!  Hubby and I probably would have hung out for a while and enjoyed some coffee/tea but were inclined to leave as it was no longer comfortable.  But the food was yummy and the prices were decent.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Eggplant sandwich was awesome, highly rec this place for a quick bite for less than three people.  It's a cafe-style place with smaller tables and not much elbow room with more than 3.
author: PJ T.

description: Really nice spot.  Great seating outside for a sunny day.  The food was delicious and very fresh.  Perfect spot for a relaxed and tasty meal.  Very reasonable prices as well.
author: Bonnie M.

description: This is a must visit!  you'll enjoy the owner's warm and helpful atmosphere!  will be a hit spot, so make sure you become a regular quick!
author: Myron P.

description: I came to The Blue Fig for a working brunch since they offered free wifi. I was expecting a lot more based on the Yelp reviews, for both ambiance and food. The decor wasn't outstanding; it was a very much a casual neighborhood cafe. The food wasn't anything to write home about, but it was decent. Not a bad place, but also not somewhere that's on the top of my list to go back to.
author: Christine A.

description: Love the outdoor patio seating area!  The sandwich and salad were both perfectly made.  Will definitely go back again!
author: Mindy H.

description: Cute place for brunch- the Roma breakfast is good
author: Romita J.

description: Cheap, good and well prepared food menu. Floors and coffee area were very dirty unfortunately and made me worry about the owners attention to hygiene.
author: Andreas N.

description: Can't rate the food because it never showed up. My husband and I went for brunch with two friends this morning. Our friends ordered first and we ordered immediately after them. Our friends' order came out about 15 minutes later and the server told us ours would be out shortly. Fifteen minutes after that our friends were almost done eating their food and our food was still not out. My husband went in to ask about it and was rudely told "it's coming" and nothing else. Ten minutes after that, I went in and asked about it, and again was told "everything is coming out of the oven right now." To which I responded "I ordered a salad." And the cook said "everything is coming." (Mind you she had no idea what our order was nor did she look into it.) ANOTHER TEN MINUTES went by and my husband went in again, this time to ask for our money back. This is when someone actually looked into it and figured out our order had been lost. Had someone had the decency to look into it the first time we asked, they would have figured that out earlier. We got a refund and left hungry. Will never go back again.
author: James P.

description: Awesome people, great prices.  You can feel good about popping in here for a bite, but there was no, "oooh I gotta go back for that," moment.
author: Theresa B.

description: Abso-friggin-lutely LOVE this place. Been going here every Saturday and Sunday for the last 3 weekends. The Roma breakfast sandwich always hits the spot. Follow it up with a white mocha and a blue waffle, and you're golden. Why 4 stars? Well they're short staffed and small, so sometimes you do wait exceptionally long. This past weekend I waited 45 minutes to find out they forgot my order! Other than the occasional slip up its great! And the sister baristas are awesome too!
author: Aabhas S.

description: If they want to be more than a coffee pour house, need to fix the kitchen. Slow, indifferent service, uneven portions, and from what I saw, the hipper kids get their food first, even when ordered later.
author: Brian K.

description:
Bagel + Lox is spectacular. Croque Madame (brioche bread with bechamel and ham with gruyere cheese) was also interesting, if not tasty. The coffee ain't bad either. 

The service is great. Everyone is super friendly and helpful. 

Also amazed how beautifully they slice tomatoes here. I usually dislike tomatoes in my sandwiches, but they were so fresh-looking and delicately cut that I kept them in my sandwich. Random, but once you see these tomato slices, you'll feel the same way too.
author: Christie C.

description: I love this place and have been a regular since they opened.  All the people working there are really friendly and it's a great place for casual dining and coffee.  If you're going for breakfast food, try the egg sandwich and ask them to put it on ciabatta.  Excellent.  I will say that I miss the days before The Blue Fig was discovered.  Now that it's become so popular I sometimes skip it because it's too busy.
author: Terry C.

description: I love this  place! it is my pit stop in Sf when i come over the bridge from Berkeley to see my boyfriend in the Mission. It is the perfect place to get a bite to eat and relax. The Food is really- very good.Their rendition of the Ruben sandwich is so outstanding. Yummy, gooey, and decadent.The owner is really trying to do things with quality and flair. I think this place is a gem to be discovered!
author: shelly m.

description: I absolutely love the service here. Everyone who I've run into working here is super nice and friendly. They'll smile and ask you how you are doing. Good music is played not too loud and their coffee and sandwiches are yummy. A great place to grab some lunch, enjoy the atmosphere and perhaps work for a bit. Looking forward to when they'll be opening some tables in the back.
author: Ben N.

description:
I ordered a double espresso and I chose a pre-made slice of a baked tart- it had walnuts, raisins and dates, with a nice flaky pastry.
The espresso was one of the best I've had in the mission. Freshly roasted, flavoursome and well-made.
The tart was good - rich and well-matched with the coffee. The pastry shell was of an even thickness,flaky and crisp. Not a trace of sogginess.
author: Nick T.

description: You would think this is just a coffee place, but when you walk inside, you will be delighted by the breakfast/food offerings as well.  We were looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat before we hit a nearby craft show.  It's a bit small, but they have a patio area in the back.  We ordered their egg sandwich and their blue waffle.  Yummy Yummy, Yummy!  Service was extremely friendly and helpful as well.
author: Leslie C.

description:
My friend and I have traveled far and wide across the city looking for cafes that provide a good environment for studying, writing and working. We're not particularly picky, and given the plethora of coffee shops in SF, you'd think we'd have plenty of options. Sadly, this is not the case. Our criteria: 
-free WiFi
-decent food, good coffee
-not crazy loud music
-plugs for charging laptops
-close to public transportation so we dont have to pay for parking and deal with re-parking our cars every two hours 

So far The Blue Fig has been one of our favorites. It's not a big space, but has great music, delicious food, good coffee and doesn't give off that annoying, pretentious hipster vibe that places like The Summit or Ritual do. The barista and everyone who works at The Blue Fig are super nice. The bathroom is clean, which is important if you plan on working there throughout the day. It got a little busy around lunch time, but overall seems to have just the right amount of traffic.
The baked goods are yummy too :)

Would totally recommend this place for a quick bite to eat or to come and spend the day studying, etc.
Yay for The Blue Fig!!!!
author: Rabia K.

description:
Frequently closes up to an hour early for no apparent reason, even when there are new customers coming in. I have witnessed the counter guy turn people away coming in at 6pm (they are supposed to close at 7pm) because he already "turned off the machines". If you close at 6, just say you close at 6. 
Also saw the counter guy, who was the only one working, smoking a joint outside. I don't have a problem with you smoking, but maybe take a walk, not right in front of the business? 
Finally, toilet is frequently messed up so I have had to lift the back of the tank and manually flush multiple times. 
On the plus side, they have decent tea and food and a nice outdoor space. But the general employee attitude is pretty bad and not customer focused. Hope they read this bc it is a decent cafe and could do better with an attitude shift.
author: A F.

description: They were SO nice here.  I had some kind of Greek yogurt concoction with honey and yummy hot toasted walnuts.  Also, some chai tea.  All good.  Nice people.  And never as crowded as Ritual or Mission Creek.  Really great place to stop in for a snack and read the paper.  Reasonably clean bathroom--not easy to find in the Mission.
author: Maisie G.

description: I really like it here. Unassuming and comfortable, very friendly people who work here -- from the cashier to the cooks. Very clean but not austere. They always have a friendly word and smile for me and I come in at least once a week. More important, the food is fresh, reasonable, made at least partially from organic/sustainable ingredients and very tasty. Note though: You can't be in a rush if you choose to come here -- they make everything to order and it can take a while to get your food.
author: Kate A.

description: Went there for brunch with a group of friends. It's more the solo or couple sort of cafe, but we worked it out by pushing a couple tables together. I wouldn't call this a brunch spot, but the breakfast was good. Both the food and the coffee were good. Too many hipsters, though.
author: Amanda W.

description: Sorry you have crap waffles.  Your hot chocolate was not choclatey enough. Pass.
author: ALOK M.

description: The baristas are friendly, their foam skills are truly art, and the egg sandwich on bagel is it die for.  Actually, all the food is quite wonderful.  I come here frequently.
author: Mark O.

description:
Really good food
Good coffee
Tea looks interesting

Only thing its WAY to slow for serving, if you order food I mean you can wait even 30 minutes for your food! happened like 3 times? yes. 

I've tried Croque Madame or Croque something...can't remember
Had many times the Breakfast Bruschetta light pieces of bread with something on top.. with my coffee
author: Geena T.

description: The food at this place is a solid three stars. My blue corn waffle was artfully prepared with seasonal strawberries, a fig reduction, and whipped cream. I also shared the croque madame, which was tasty. It was packed with whole grain mustard (my favorite!), and had plenty of thin sliced ham. The staff was friendly, and offered table side service. I would definitely stop by TBF again if I were in the neighborhood, but would probably not go out of my way to return. Excited to check out the rear patio space once it is completed.
author: David M.

description:
if you like mediocre egg sandwiches that cost $7, take half an hour to make, with service without even a hello or thank you - you have found a match. 

+1 for the name of the place.
author: Valentin B.

description: The good reviews on yelp inspired me to try The Blue Fig today for breakfast and it definitely did not disappoint. TBF offers a simple menu, you seat yourself, and order the food at the counter type of place. My friend and I both tried the Egg Sandwich--it was a yummy combination of egg, ham, cheese, and spread on some tasty bread. They also have decent coffee here. I had the Latte. I would definitely add this to my Rotation List for Breakfast/Brunch in SF!
author: Barbra C.

description: The Blue Fig is another one of those sandwich/coffee/brunch places that have sprouted up all over the city.  This place has the typical menu that  these kind of establishments usually have.  The breakfast sandwich I ordered was good, yet not distinguishable from any nearby cafe.  The service was slower than usual here however.
author: Andy Z.

description: A cheap place to get some mediocre breakfast.  Service was friendly... lots of natural lighting through the big windows.
author: Danny C.

description: A great breakfast or place to stop for a quick snack.  I love their Croque Madame, the bechamel sauce is right on point.  And try the Reuben, the pastrami is GREAT quality.  The sauerkraut is pickly, but not overwhelming, it's the perfect balance.  People are nice, service is on point.  Nice place to hang out and chill since wifi is available.
author: Adam N.

description: Got the croque madame and the blue waffle. I really liked the croque madame, it was creamy, had a lot of ham, good egg, and I liked the sweet and creamy sauce that was glazed over. I was not a huge fan of the waffle though. The waffle was just meh... I liked the syrup that was placed on top (it reminded me of this date syrup called seelan), but that was it. It was a quaint little place and it was kind of cool to see one guy cooking up everything for everyone. Exactly what I think of when I hear mom and pop shop.
author: Brandon R.

description: Got the turkey sandwich - meat was good (not overly processed tasting or salty) and the bread was perfect.  My friend got the breakfast sandwich which was really good too.  I think I just felt for the price it was a bit too simple...I think I wanted to be a little bit more wowed.
author: Irene K.

description: Great place to meet for quick brunch. Nice staff really small inside though . Better to eat outside in the back patio. Good food. I ordered a French sandwich ... "Madame" will be back to see what else is good on the menu.
author: Leah M.
