description: Salads were pretty good - just had too much dressing. The staff were extremely unfriendly and sour. That was just unpleasant - there's no harm in smiling, or greeting a customer, or just being polite. And for that reason I most likely will not return.
author: Farzana G.

description: The turkey sandwich really is THAT GOOD. Also I had the croque madame for brunch, that was great too. You can tell the people here really try hard to make good food. Coffee is great too. Highly recommended.
author: Charles G.

description: Took a nice stroll on sunny day.  Goood, not great.  Got some egg sandwich that had tons of gravy and green sauce on it.  Needed hot sauce and salt, edible.  Coffee and tea good.  Brunch partner thought meal good.  Rickety tables, close together.  Small spot so hard to make comfy.  Its a casual place.
author: Tim M.

description:
I like the vibe of the staff, and the room, very unpretentious. Their home-cured lox on the weekends is amazing (but they often seem to run out or not have it ready). 

The food is a bit overpriced though, especially for what you get - a lot of the plates look a little sad and empty or at least rather austere. The waffles are decent - but you have to pay an eye-watering 1.75 for real maple syrup, and when I ordered it they left on the balsamic reduction which utterly drowned out the maple taste so it was wasted.

Coffee is fine but nothing special. Pastries are mostly the usual, nothing too special, although the muffins are good. Unless you're getting the lox, it's better for coffee and hanging out than meals.
author: La M.

description: Ordered a small caramel cappuccino today which was not tasty at all. Too much syrup so I could not drink it. 3.75 for a small coffee in this neighborhood is too expensive. The only good thing was that I got my money back. This happens when people think everyone could make a good coffee.
author: Chris S.

description: The sidewalk cafe  and patio seating is very nice.The French toast and coffee we're excellent.It's  to bad there are no free coffee refills.
author: Alexa S.

description: I ordered the Reuben. It was good. I was distracted in my enjoyment of the Reuben, however, by my two friends who ordered the croque madame and the savory waffle. Very delicious, all! My experience was enhanced by being in the warm sunny back open air space and I was pleasantly entertained by the tea delivery devices that pour by utilizing pressure plates. Extra stars go to the proprietor for being receptive to marriage proposals regarding the flavor of her creations!
author: Andy K.

description:
food-only review:

came in on a weekday 'round 6pm. notice they've got a bfast menu.  ask the man behind the counter if by some miracle they do bfast all day... AND HE SAID YES!

what's better than bfast for dinner?  well, i got the CROQUE MADAME which (although its only served by itself) was pretty freakin awesome.  

the gentleman who served me was extremely polite and friendly too.  i'll be back to try more of their all-day bfast.

----
UPDATE:
went back and had the reuben, and that was SOLID too (comes with greens).

additional plus: free wifi
author: dan a.

description:
you look in here and it's hard for your first reaction to not be "wtf?!?" because the decor is pretty much awful. really, non-existent. it's on par with muddy waters at 24th and valencia, and hence you might expect the drinks/food/service to be at that horrid level.

NOT THE CASE

the service is wonderful. soooo friendly. witty banter, accommodating to changes to items, explanations for why they can't do certain things (no poached eggs... no way to boil the egg!). 

very tasty food! the french toast was divine. my friend's eggs were fantastic, and she's quite picky.

so, look past the decor (or, blue fig, fix it up a little bit.. give it some character. it doesn't need to be trendy, just .. any character), smile and eat up.
author: omar k.

description:
I absolutely love, love, LOVE the Blue Fig!  

I keep coming back for the Croque Madame, it is out of this world, seriously I'm addicted.  I had a Croque Madame in Las Vegas recently and paid twice as much and it wasn't half as good.    I also love the blue corn waffle with the bananas, whipped cream and fig reduction, it all goes together so nicely.   The coffee is great as is their assortment of teas.  

The best part is Chef Rahmi (sp?) and the staff, I always get treated extra special and their smiles and great attitude make for a great start to my day!   The cafe has great energy. 

Best wishes Blue Fig for a long and lively life on Valencia!
author: Pam T.

description: Amazing food! The flavors just burst out.  We felt that the food was comparable to the high-end Fine Cuisine found around SF.  We will definitely go back when we are in the area.
author: Mantecan D.

description: Haven't tried their food yet, but I had a great cup of coffee here the other day!  The female barista who took my order was super nice, and the whole place, although small, felt very warm and inviting. I'll definitely come here again.
author: Carly G.

description: Cute place with tasty coffee and sandwiches. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
author: Elsa M.

description: Such a adorable cozy place! Came here a while back with one of my girlfriend's for a sunday brunch. Shared a waffle with strawberries and bananas & some type of syrup (fig?) on top. Delicious! Their lattes are really good too. We also had an egg sandwich , yummy for my tummy. Didn't expect for it to be so small of a restaurant but I liked how they had a couple tables outside in front where you could sit. Super hipster atmosphere. Definetly come here if youre in the area ! Btw, staff is so friendly and nice!
author: Colette P.

description: Really tasty breakfast sandwiches in the InterMission region.  And they serve 'em all day, as far as I can tell.  Hard to go wrong with tasty ham, cheese and egg on a good bagel.
author: Oliver N.

description: Very cute, clean new place in the Mission! I love their tea setup. I can't explain it, just get it. Free wifi and yummy-looking food, though I didn't partake. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Allison L.

description:
Seriously disappointed. 
The three working behind the counter were joking around and the service was miserable. The order was so simple: 2 bagels and 2 coffees. The bagels were miserably toasted and the three employees completely neglected to make our coffees when we were the only people in the cafe. The coffee was burnt and cappuccino was mostly foam. And it was $10. Don't go here.
author: Zachary P.

description: Nice, mellow spot to get a coffee/tea and breakfast sandwich. Nothing spectacular, but the place is clean and friendly and the food is cheap, fresh, and tasty. They serve mighty leaf organic teas, in case you're interested.
author: Zack F.

description: Very friendly place, good music, they'll make you anything you ask for (even if it's not on the menu). Try the egg sandwich.
author: Kaushik K.

description: A decent morning brew (you know, cup of coffee) and the best in the nieghborhood in the reasonable price range. The menu offerings are tasty and consistly good!
author: James-Jimm P.

description: Located in the mission this is a fast place for brunch with a coffee shop ambiance. The food is outstanding (have tried the croque madam, the egg sandwich, and the blue waffle) and the coffee is decent. During the week seating was easily available.
author: Terry P.

description: Such a lovely little cafe!  Rami, the chef, came out to chat with my friend and I, and I was just so charmed.  His culinary influences range from Morocco to France to Sweden and beyond, and you can taste it in these delectable dishes!  I tried the blue waffle while my friend got the turkey sandwich.  Both were clearly made with top-notch ingredients and prepared with care.  Loved it.
author: Laurie D.

description: Food is great, coffee is OK but overpriced. What really irks me is that when you order to-go, they don't take your name, so on busy mornings when everyone is ordering an egg sandwich (delicious, totally recommended), it's pretty common to have your order delivered to someone else and/or get someone else's order. Very very frustrating.
author: John S.

description: The Blue Fig Cafe is a great place to get breakfast. The Croque Madame is delicious, and so was the blue waffle! The unique flavors that was present in the croque madame really made the restaurant a favorite breakfast place for me. They also have fresh delicious orange juice as well. Oh yeah, this place is cash only, so make sure you remember to hit the ATM beforehand, although there is one in the restaurant as well!
author: Rachel T.

description: The Croque Provencal was spectacular. Very few kitchens in SF are capable of turning out anything that great. It looked like it came off of the cover of Gourmet Magazine, and it tasted even better. I have read some of the 2- and 3-star reviews and, quite frankly, they seem like they were written by spoiled kids. This place is excellent.
author: Willie P.

description:
I got hooked on the best $2 cup of coffee on Valencia, found out quickly that the food is fantastic as well. The croque madame cures hangovers and the reuben bourgeois ennui (for a little while). The staff is awesome.

Pastries need some work (send someone down to Arizmendi?) and maybe some more wall art?
author: Stephan M.

description:
perfect place for stopping, chatting and resting in a sunny afternoon. outdoor tables are the cherry on the cake. 
friendly service and good coffee :)
author: Ajeje B.

description: This place is small and casual, but their food and coffee is absolutely delicious.
author: Andie D.

description: Friendly, simple little place with a limited breakfast menu.  The egg sandwich was excellent, while the blue waffle didn't live up to the hype on this site.  Excellent coffee.  Not a destination place, but a good place to stop in if you're passing by.
author: John K.

description: Reasonably priced food that tastes good.  I had a latte and the fried egg sandwich with ham.  The service was fast.  I managed to find parking nearby.  It was a good experience!
author: Niniane W.

description:
Really 3.5 stars. The owner of this place is friendly, affable  - which always helps. My boyfriend ordered a Croque Monsieur and the owner offered to make it for him even though they don't actually have it (it is Croque Madame on the menu).

So my boyfriend ended up having the Croque Madame which was AMAZING. I wish I had ordered it. I had the special, a veggie breakfast sandwich, which just wasn't very yummy - it was on a ciabatta role which was too hard and not tasty at all - it was supposed to be served on focaccia bread but they had run out of focaccia. 

Pleasant, simple ambience. Overall a great place.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Waffle wasn't that good: soggy and expensive. Also, I had to pay extra to avoid the log cabin quality corn syrup.  I understand to pay extra for maple, but perhaps they could have their standard be something kind of reasonable, like agave or apple cider syrup?
author: Michael C.

description: Amazing food and relaxed vibe. Service is friendly. The egg sandwich is delicious. Totally recommend.
author: Cathy L.

description: Breakfast cafe place, not ideal for brunch!  More of a coffee shop with more food choices than a restaurant.  I don't get why the waffle gets so much raved reviews, it's pretty standard waffle fare for me. Would stop by for a quick breakfast, but portions definitely not enough for a brunch, would need more like two dishes.
author: Li Y.

description: This a phenomenal new cafe on Valencia. The ambiance of the space was limited but the food was just amazing. The waffle with the fig sauce was perhaps the best waffle I've had. And their chef, who seems to be the owner/manager as well, came over to chat about the food. It was clear that he really cared. Looks like they might open up a patio in the back if they can get authorization. In any case, I predict that this place will be amazing for at least another year, so now is a good time to check it out.
author: Jacob A.

description:
The Blue Fig is hands down my favorite cafe in the world.

The staff is fantastic, and the food and coffee are phenomenal.

I don't like figs, but I love The Blue Fig.
author: Ben G.

description: The Blue Fig has wonderful owners and staff.  It's clean, friendly and warm.  The food is very tastey and the coffee is among the best in the city.  I rarely miss a weekend there.  This is my coffee house of choice after trying many others in the Mission and elsewhere.  If you're in the area, please do support these good people.
author: Gene M.

description: Reuben sandwich was delicious!!! Waffle was awesome!! Really inviting cozy cafe on valencia. Great helpful staff. The owner was really nice. He actually approached our table to see how were doin. Really yummy place to visit =)
author: Ryan B.

description: I expected it to be a new, pretentious, hipster-laden cafe in the Mission. But after my 1st visit, I realized I just found a new favourite lunch spot in my 'hood. Its casual; the owners are there - working; the menu while small is interesting.
author: Paawan K.

description: Tasty little sandwich, and my friend's waffle looked scrumptious. Everything was artfully presented, and the service was fantastic!
author: David J.

description: Very hospitable and excellent food. Come here every weekend for breakfast and coffee. Family owned.
author: Khalil S.

description: Overpriced yuppie food. Blue waffle was like 1/3 of a breakfast for $7, perfect size for one of those tiny women who eats like a bird, complaining half a bagel is way too much for her because she is left feeling bloated after. Coffee was meh. Wait staff sullen hipster attitude. Might be a nice place to hang if you don't actually care about the food and drink.
author: Preston G.

description: Although it may not seem like it when you look at the Blue Fig from the outside, the food is actually pretty good. The owner seems like a nice guy and he has friendly staff working for him.
author: Vivek N.

description: Came here to grab something really quick since I had 15 mins left on the meter after getting a massage.  Omg how long does it take to get a freaking turkey sandwich to go...the answer...more than 15 mins, probably about 20 mins.  I came back and there was no time left on the meter but thankfully no ticket on my windshield.  I got home and ate the sandwich, which was actually really good.  The cheese was melted and part that had melted off was crispy like parmasan crisps.  Every couple bites there was a flavor that came across that was slightly reminicent of pizza.  I guess it was the combo of the mushroom tapanade and the cheese?  The portion was a little small considering it cost around $8, but it was good so I guess if I had some time to get food and I was in the area I would come back.
author: Tabitha S.

description: Great service, convenient location, fresh food (they cure their own salmon!) and just overall a great small cafe feel with local fresh taste. The only caveat is that they're cash and run out of salmon by the end of the week but it's a small price to pay for excellent eats.
author: Tracy H.

description: Sigh. $2.75 for a cookie, followed by the barrista accidentally putting the thin paper baked-item bag on a wet counter then giving me a hard time about my wanting a new cookie. And the new cookie was so dry I tossed it after the second bite. (What was I looking for? Not wet (especially with foreign liquids). Not dry. Moist. Cookies are best moist.)
author: Charles B.

description: This cafe offers outside seating which is great for people watching and when the weather is nice. It also offers backyard seating. The wealth of seating may contribute to the slow service and long line. I went with two other people and were a bit disappointed. The line was long and slow, tables inside and out remained uncleared and dirty for 30 minutes, and it took forever for our food to be served. When the food was served, it was served with 5-10 minutes between dishes so the first of us had finished his meal 15 minutes before the third person was served. That was a bummer. The dishes sound better on the board than they are in reality.
author: Eliz M.

description: We stopped here for breakfast and I had the egg sandwich which was delicious. Not much on atmosphere in the cafe but the garden in the back looks interesting. The staff was friendly enough. All in all, a pretty good place to have a quick breakfast on a weekday morning.
author: Cortney W.

description: Decent coffee, sub-par food, nice casual atmosphere. The back patio is great. I had a breakfast sandwich and I can make better breakfast sandwiches in my own kitchen on a Tuesday morning. I'd go back for coffee and a cookie, but not hot food.
author: Katie P.

description: This is a great spot. The owner is super nice and the food is amazing!! It is right by my house so I will be here a ton. Coffee is delicous and they will have a back patio very soon which is going to make it even better. Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Candace C.

description: I usually just get Iced coffee or a breakfast sandwich - you really can't go wrong with either!  Staff is great. Only downfall is cash only.
author: Alex H.

description: Food was okay but we ordered coffee and they pretty much forgot about the order.  We went up to ask for it to go because it was literally taking 30 minutes.  The guy then made two really shitty drinks: a cappuccino and a regular coffee.  Both sucked and ha d to throw them away.  Worst restaurant I've been to in the bay area since I moved here almost a year ago.  This goes for the entire customer experience.  Again, I had the blue waffle and it was good.  It's just that idiot assholes work there.  Sorry, I'm not sorry.
author: Robert G.

description: Food was really tasty and reasonably priced. I got the egg sandwich, which came with some really flavorful ham. The staff is pretty friendly too, a nice change of pace from being judged at Ritual down the street. On the other hand, the coffee tasted burnt. So I guess you can come here for half your breakfast.
author: Victor L.

description: great salads, but the coffee is a bit expensive for what it is. overall awesome food! :) i like the casual atmosphere too.
author: Hello G.

description: Wonderful mixed greens salad, but terrible service.  My table was dirty and the young guy at the counter seemed depressed or extremely bored.  Surprising service compared to everywhere else in this city.
author: S H.

description: We enjoyed it, super nice staff, not a huge breakfast and food  menu, but a coffee place with some food.  Everything was very good.  We dying to come back?  No.  But we are not upset we went.   If we lived closer, we would probably come back more.
author: michael d.

description: The salad was not good.  A cold turkey sandwich and a salad took 30 minutes to get to the table.  and the line was another 15.  The only good thing about this place is the outside seating on valencia st.  Would not repeat.
author: Theresa B.

description: The blue waffle is delicious and the latte was the best I've had in ages. Very pleasant outdoor patio, service was fast and the bathroom was clean. One request: have the waiter bring silverware with the order. It's silly to be settled in and have to get up to get your utensils, and the box of silverware contained crumbs.
author: Matt W.

description: This is a fantastic cafe. The food is lovely and satisfying, the coffee delicious and strong, and the staff skilled and friendly. The only drawback is that it's too small for its level of awesomeness; I feel a little bad loitering over breakfast when new patrons are standing around looking for non-existent empty tables.
author: William P.

description: Awesome food undermined by the harsh modernist granite feeling of the seating. Still worth it.
author: Charlie Bolognese Z.

description: very nice coffee / breakfast shop in veggie corner (valencia and 21st). great service and looking fprward to trying more things on their menu.
author: Roy N.

description: lol, i saw`the pics on yelp, went to blue fig and asked for a latte with pac-man, and the guy made it for me, SO COOL
author: Bernard W.

description: The soup was good, and four stars is an accurate rating.  Small improvement are still possible.
author: Gregory D.

description: Okay but not fantastic. Corn waffle okay but fake maple syrup. Smoked salmon bagel good. Smallish portions. Would rate 2.5 if i could. Won't be returning.
author: Jeff T.

description: Nice people and yummy food, but a bit overpriced for the portions.
author: Zeke A.

description: Awesome Spot for lunch! The staff was just so nice! The chef and the barista were just so nice. The chef gave my girlfriend and I a sample of their figs. mmm. so yummy! I had the vegetarian sandwich without the mozzarella. Oh man it was awesome!!! I will definitely be going back! Great sevice and great food.
author: J S.

description: Top quality food at a very reasonable price, excellent atmosphere, friendly owners and service. Check it out I promise you will not be disappointed.
author: dave t.

description: great sandwiches for a reasonable price. the sandwiches are made fresh and are so crispy with the first few bites. if you eat slow like me you might start to feel the sogginess begin to develop but it's delicious no matter what. the salads are very healthy too and you feel so good about eating there compared to a fast food restaurant. the plates come out beautifully decorated unlike the simplicity of the store, and parking is relatively easy if you don't mind paying the meter.
author: Kristine C.
